author: {'steamid': '76561198036114151', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1622995034}
review:
Grand Theft Auto: lll... the Three is censored and is really meant to say "Mid"

SPOILERS!!!!
Wow where do I begin with this monstrosity of a "video game"? Look, I get that this was the first open world do whatever the hell you want game in existence that released on the Playstation 2 and Original Xbox, but man this game made me realize that people back then didn't have SHIT in their video games. Like honestly, this game is held for its goundbreaking technology and advancements in gaming, but there is literally nothing more than driving mediocre controls and shooting 6 different weapons. The world is so dead, the AI is somewhat better than Cyberpunk, the story is god awful, and everything is forgettable in this game. The story? What fucking story, it's nonexistent. All you really get told is that you get backstabbed by two Cartel members, one is an ex-girlfriend, and then you just start working for the Mob's Capo right off the bat. That is some terrible starting position for a story. There is no grind or sense of achievement in the story whatsoever, you just do random dirty work for criminals with no real explanation. You betray major characters more than once for no real reason, and you don't have a real goal for a mass majority of the game. Once you're through with 90% of the game, you find yourself with one true goal... Revenge (lol).

Play this if you want to experience a boring and outdated video game that doesn't hold up to todays standards, but to experience the stepping stones that rockstar laid out for the gaming industry that we all know today. Lol

Loved it? Hate it? Do you think I'm stupid? Leave a comment down below and see you in the next review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161730465', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4236, 'last_played': 1669925952}
review:
Despite its rudimentary nature compared to the games that followed it, this is still one of my favourite games in the GTA series. I used one of the mod packs available in the guides section (the HD fix) and also installed 'HD Vehicles Tri-Pack III' to make the cars look a bit more pleasing. It's annoying that you have to mod the game to make it run properly on a modern PC - it would be pretty easy for Rockstar to sort this out pre-sale - but ultimately it's really easy to install the available mod packs.

For some reason the handling of the boats was absolutely awful, which made a few of the water-based missions a chore to complete, but other than that I enjoyed completing the game 100% (for the fourth time - it would have been five times had it not been for the infamous Purple Nines bug on the PS2).

author: {'steamid': '76561198069263492', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1623221640}

review: This game will always be a special game for me since this is the my first sandbox, triple A, GTA game that I played. Now that I finally finished it, it is a great game albeit challenging. Although LC is the smallest map in the 3d GTA game, it did not feel small due to the densely packed buildings. Radio is not as good as other 3d gta game but that is to be expected since this is the first 3d game in the series. Overall, a fun experience to mess around with like other gta games if you know how to fix the game for modern computers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1621361215}
review:
Grand Theft Auto III (2001)

The first full 3D Grand Theft Auto game, GTA III puts you in the shoes of Claude as you enter a world of crime, drugs, gang warfare, and corruption. My man Claude doesn't speak but that's fine. Makes him all so much more enjoyable as he litterly can't say anything that would upset people. Your basically a puppet running from mission to mission shooting people and collecting money to buy better guns to shoot more people with. The story is fine and it's fun to explore Liberty City. When I first played this game I couldn't believe its the same city that number 4 plays off in but I then learned it plays a rather big roll in pretty much all the GTA games. As far as GTA games go, number III is a classic. I did die a lot but I always got back up to kick ass all over again. Fun fact - the radio station Flashback FM only got 5 songs, but they are all from the movie Scarface - I loved that.

8/10

"Oh she's on fire! Luckily I've never have been... I've done a lot of crazy things, I can tell you that... but I've never been on fire... at least not to my knowledge." - Toni, Flashback FM DJ

review:
Please don't misunderstand me. The game is a classic and brought a lot to the gaming industry back in the day. Unfortunately it hasn't aged well. It just doesn't work well in the new systems.
Regardless, it is worth giving it a go for a nostalgia trip. The soundtrack is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105515822', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1621112489}
review:
First off, this game (San Andreas & Vice City too) is not designed or updated for modern systems. The menus don't display text, the resolution is weird, it crashes, and many other problems. Most of these issues can be fixed with the "Classic Enhanced" mod pack, but Rockstar really shouldn't be selling a product that requires mods to work.

Secondly, this game just hasn't aged very well. There are a lot of annoyances and missing features that make playing it today just not as good as it could be. One of the biggest of these is that there is no map screen, so you basically have to memorize the layout of the map from driving around. Also, the stores like Ammunation and the spray shop don't show up on the minimap, so finding them can be really tricky. Whenever you die or are busted by cops you lose all of your weapons, and if you die ore are busted during a mission you have to drive all the way back to the mission start point. Also there is no 'quit mission' option, so if you want to do this the only way I know of is committing self kill.

I played about 10% of the missions before calling it quits. I don't think this game is bad, I just think it isn't worth the $10 price, especially considering you have to mod it to get it running right. I would love to see a remake or re-release of this game with updated controls and features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198868577159', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1677508278}
review:
2001, Liberty City.
Welcome to GTA 3. A game by rockstar games.
This game was a huge acomplishment for rockstar games due to it being the first 3D gta game they made.
The story is about a criminal named "claude speed" who got betrayed by his girlfriend, catalina. I'm not going to spoil more of the story, but the characters are cool.
MUSIC: As the lyrics of "bump to the music" from Lips 106 say: "To the right stuff, to the music!"
INTERACTIVITY: Not that much. it's still good.
STORY: 7/10.
DETAILS: Not that much. There might appear a rainbow after a in-game rain, but that's the only detail I know.
VIOLENCE: BLOOD! BLOOD! GORE! GIBS!
The game's rating overall: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198299285150', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2282, 'last_played': 1583038756}
review:
First playthrough review time.

GTA-3 is the first 3D game of the entire franchise with a protagonist and a sequal to GTA:Sanandreas.Gameplay is lot more different from GTA-2 and london series which are top-down perspective view games.This is the first GTA game with introduction to cutscenes ,voiceacting,sidemissions and hidden packages etc.Gameplay and plot is good but there are bugs which are not fixed and can be fixed with available mods by installing it.

Completed 100% of the game which includes extra content besides main missions.For completionists it may take time to locate all the collectables as it might be difficult  at the first glance of the area but still possible which depends upon individual .Overall introduction to 3D environment of the franchise with many non existing features compared to previous series made gameplay more different.

review: Highly recommend it even still. Short answer, no, it doesn't hold up well today. But the only reason for that is every subsequent GTA has improved upon the formula GTA3 created. review: ... I won't lie, this game aged like fine milk and new gamers will probably not enjoy this anywhere near as much as something like GTA 5 or even 4. That said, it's still GTA 3 and it's still a classic. It's EXTREMELY difficult for all the wrong reasons, but if you're up to the challenge and don't mind the often cryptic nature of the game, go right on ahead! It's a ride, I'll tell you that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867074421', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5590, 'last_played': 1647132965}
review: I'm playing the GTA series for the first time... 20 years later. This is the best game I've ever played in my ENTIRE life. I like it way more than Vice City, maybe because the missions are easier, aside from that tedious paramedic mission. Who knew being a silent, sociopathic traitor would be fun? For anyone else who is playing this 2 decades later, I would recommend finding the hidden packages and completing the paramedic, vigilante, and firefighter missions first. This will help you memorize the map right away and have access to better weapons, making the main missions easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050870521', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1619932373}
review:
Loved this game when it first came out on the PS2 however it is essentially unplayable without mods.

Things that are implemented poorly:
- Proper controller support.
- a map where you can see your character in the pause menu like in vice city or san andreas. This means you can only see things on the radar in your immediate vicinity.
- Camera movement / manipulation is garbage.
- Steering of vehicles is poor even compared to other gta games of the era.
- Some missions are extremely difficult if not done at the start of the game. E.g. trying to do the ambulance missions after youve completed the game will end up in you being blown up by the mafia, triads, columbians etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844037725', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1634496030}
review: A genuinely fun game, even without the scope of nostalgia. The freedom in how you execute each mission gave this game a feeling that the later gtas would go on to lose. This is a game where instead of killing your target after a chase, you can plant a bomb pre-custcene to initiate the chase and blow up the target with an ignition bomb instead of a conventional weapon. You can completely skip waves of enemies before your target by just running them over, including the target. You can use cars as obstacles to trap targets in alleys and catch them faster... you get the point. Considering most games today handhold you all the way through a game with 0 remorse for any deviation, this game still holds up as a genuinely unique and fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960446371', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1618412228}
review: Basically this game doesn't work on a semi modern PC. I have an i5-4460 with GTX 960Ti, a 24inch wuxga monitor and an xbox one controller. Pretty old but new compared to the release date of this game (2001). You can read plenty of comments online about how badly this game behaves with the controller, widescreen monitors and graphics cards. No menu displayed, choppy performance, wide screen altering targeting, controller not mapping sensibly etc. There are online fixes for some of this but its as a lot of work to make a game just barely playable then after a few missions it started crashing every time I got in a car and after a repair on the game files it now wont load into the previous save game at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198884497056', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1618330182}

I played this game as a child but I never finished, Well today I end a chapter in my life and I finished GTA 3 for the first and probably last time. 
Great game its a bit of a shame that Claude can't talk, also I find Claude the creepiest protagonist from all the GTA Series isn't it? 
The story was good, But man what the hell happend with Toni broooo! He put on some wight man.
Overall 
I recommend this game to play if you only played all the GTA series before.  (San Andreas, Vice City, Libery City Stories)

author: {'steamid': '76561198410051476', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1617684843}
review: I just beat the game. I played it when I was 12 years old and now. Let me tell you, very satisfying.  Great game, good missions (difficult, save often) You can´t beat the feeling of beating a game again after roughly 20 years. Really happy I bought it again worth the 4 bucks I paid for it and then some. When you see the BIG C you better be ready, you will know once you get there. If you are having trouble getting the game to run on windows 10 you need to run a compatibility diagnostic test. This will give you the option to change the game to windows xp which is what you need to run it on. Once I did that it ran fine no problems. ( I did download the version 1.0 from the guides section you might have to do that as well. ) The controls were a little strange in the beginning and it will take an hour or so to get use to. If you are thinking about buying this game and you played it as a kid, BUY IT, set it up properly, and relive your childhood a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978408855', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 5064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3397, 'last_played': 1657520990}
review:
Grand Theft Auto III one of the most famous games of all time. It’s crime-focused open world revolutionized gaming forever, setting the template for future open world games. However, it’s been nearly 20 years since the game was released. Has it held up?

Driving is simple, but effective. Controls are easy to use with KB+M and most cars are not slippery, so driving around town and getting from point A to point B is simple. It’s nothing special, but it works. Car physics are very arcadey, though, so realism fans will need to adjust to how III’s cars work.

The most notable thing about driving isn’t the driving controls or handling, but how little damage vehicles can take. Regular cars take a surprisingly small amount of damage before the engine starts going up in flames, while sports cars feel like they’re made out of paper. The only cars that have the durability you expect in later games are the heavier ones. This is a double-edged sword; while this means enemies can destroy you easily in cars, this also means you can shred enemy vehicles with ease. It adds an interesting risk/reward to drive-bys and missions with combat.

Boat handling is good, but the big problem is that you can’t do drive-bys with them. This makes dealing with other boats awkward, as you can’t fire back if they’re on you, unlike with cars. All you can do is outpace them or, if it’s a mission, follow them until you can hit them for a pitiful amount of damage. 

Combat is basic. Your character fires in the direction the cursor is pointing at without any fancy over-the-shoulder camera or zoom in that you see in later GTA games or in modern third person shooters. It’s very primitive, but the game’s AI is extremely stupid, so killing them isn’t a problem.

The weapons are also barebones. The only exotic weapons you have are the Flamethrower and Rocket Launcher, with every other weapon being a grenade, pistol, SMG, or assault rifle. This doesn’t mean your weapon selection sucks, because several of your weapons are lethal as hell.  

Interestingly, you can carry every weapon at once, unlike later GTA games. This is overkill for the most part, as the Mini-Uzi, Shotgun, Grenades, M16, and Rocket Launcher tower over the other weapons, but it’s nice to have some extra gear to mix things up or if you’re out of ammo for them.

The world map is great…with one big exception. The first two areas, Portland and Staunton Island, are very well-connected with several side-paths.  The areas are also small enough that you can easily memorize the areas and create your own routes for things like Paramedic or evading the police without too much trouble. Fans of San Andreas and onwards will be disappointed, but it’s refreshing having a world small enough to work with and plan around with ease.

Shoreside Vale is the final area and is easily the worst one out of all the areas. The area has far poorer interconnection compared to the rest of the map, making navigation a chore at times. For an example, the area is divided into two sections via a river.  There are only two bridges (well, one bridge and one dam) that connect each side, so your options for crossing from one side to another is very limited. And, since the only aerial vehicle is a gimmicky plane and there are no boats, your options are limited to just those bridges all the time. There are also a lot of dead ends that make traveling more of a pain. Most of the map is underused in missions, so at least half of the area feels almost pointless. The only real interesting area is the airport, which takes up a surprisingly large chunk of the island for little benefit. It feels very rushed and incomplete compared to the previous locations. It’s a shame, because if Shoreside Vale was as good as the other two areas, GTA III would have the best map in the series.

There is one major issue with the map; as you progress through the game, gangs that prowl a region will become permanently hostile once you do a certain mission. This is a particular problem with one area, where a Shotgun-wielding gang will become hostile and will destroy your vehicle in seconds if they see you. To make things worse, you will anger 7 out of 9 gangs in the game if you complete all of the game’s missions and make one gang that always aggros on you be given powerful AK-47s after the final mission. This “feature” makes travel and enjoying the sandbox troublesome the further you get into the game, as driving through certain neighborhoods can make your car go from 100% to critical health in no time due to gangs going nuts and opening fire the moment they see you. Having to plan around avoiding several areas in a sandbox game is pretty dumb.

Even worse, hostile gangs make activities such as Paramedic and Firefighter very difficult, as the game will make you go to areas filled with a hostile gang that will shoot up your vehicle. This means that, if you’re going for 100%, you have to do side missions as soon as possible or else they’ll become very difficult to outright impossible because of enemy gangs.

The missions are much simpler than in other GTA games. Minigames are non-existent and gimmicks like “spook-o-meters” appear very few times. Instead, you spend most missions doing basic things like driving to certain locations to kill someone, getting a certain wanted level and evading the police, or collecting objects. It’s all barebones, but feels oddly refreshing in that you don’t have to deal with any dumb minigames or gmiccks.

The great thing about III’s missions is how open they are. Many missions are open enough to let you tackle missions how you want instead of exactly how the designers want. For example, there is a mission that requires you to hit a car until it’s dropped six pieces of evidence, then destroy the car used to collect the evidence. Instead, you can get into a tank and blow up the vehicle with a shot from the tank’s cannon, instantly completing the mission. Being able to handle missions, including some difficult ones, how you want to makes going through missions more fun and memorable than nonsensical railroading you see in later GTA games.

One big problem with the game is that money is essentially worthless in this game. Weapon shops have a limited stock and Hidden Packages make free weapons spawn at every safehouse in the game, so blowing cash on weapons is pointless except if you really, really need a certain weapon that is only gained from Hidden Packages in the final island but can be bought in the second one. There are no purchasable safehouses nor properties, so there’s no huge money sink in the game. The only other thing you can spend money on is Pay ‘n Sprays, but after a few missions or some Hidden Package hunting early in the game, you’ll have all you need to afford Pay ‘n Sprays for the entire game. It seems the developers intended money to be treated more like score than money, like how it was treated in earlier GTA games, but III isn’t a score attack game or is there a high score board. 

Grand Theft Auto III is an unusual game; it launched the GTA series into the mainstream and kickstarted the modern open world genre, but it has its own quirks that make it stand out from the games that came after it. Compared to later GTA games, it feels like a rough prototype of things to come, with basic missions, barebones combat, and a simple map. However, this can be seen as an advantage, as it avoids pitfalls later GTA and Rockstar games have fallen into, such as gimmicky missions and too much plot. Those that want a pure sandbox experience will love it, but those that like their sandboxes with minigames, a deep plot, and will find themselves bored fairly quickly. As a fan of the basics without any nonsense, this game hit the spot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 7349, 'num_reviews': 9051, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1673148078}
review:
Grand Theft Auto 3 is a kind of reboot of an old 2D top down vehicle/brawler/shooter game popularised for it's over the top violence and gangster/crime themes.   The hallmarks of the series, and this game in particular, are the somewhat comical and satirical alternative reality and the complete unfettered freedom of the open world.  Players are free to do missions or just navigate the city streets, filled with AI cars and NPCs running their own routines, making the entire simulation feel like it's living and breathing. 

The core gameplay consists of driving or third person shooting.  While GTA games are made for console and PC, the developers spend significant effort on the PC version stripping out the limitations of the consoles, making this a very rare exception to the fact that most console games cannot be recommended due to the shortcomings they bring to PC. 

The reason that the series has been so popular is the pure immersion. If you steal a car, the police will chase you.  You don't have to do missions if you don't want, you can just drive around, or steal cars and sell them, or rob people.  The missions and narratives are also extremely well done.  Another aspect of the immersion is that when you drive a car, you can listen to the radio, and there's a dozen radio stations with music, scripted radio shows, advertising, even talkback radio.   Rockstar spared no expense with the series and they paid close attention to every detail. 

Despite being launched in 2002, GTA3, being the oldest 3D GTA game, works in 4K and while the controls are not as finely dialled in as later versions, is still fun to play and gamers who missed this the first time around should pick this up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355839652', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1617536507}
review:
Okay. IF you have played san andreas or even vice city before then this will be a massive downgrade gameplaywise. If it is your first gta then its guite interesting to see how ambitious the game was for it´s time. I had a lot of fun with it but there are 2 gripes which almost ruined it for me. First of all there is no map. You have a minimap but it does not provide you with a lot of information. I never used the spray garage or the wapon store outside of missions where they were marked on the map because I just never found them again. The lack of a map is also a problem once you unlock a new area which is basically an island connected with one bridge. Before I knew the streets by heart it took me sometimes 10 minutes to find the correct street thtat leads to the bridge. This is especially frustrating if you have to restart a mission and it takes longer to find ypur way back than it takes to complete the mission. Actually it is pretty frustrating having to walk all the way back to the contract giver before you can restart a mission. Anyway my second big gripe is that at one point in the game a majority of missions will be timed. It might be challenging but it stops being fun after a while. Especially without a clear sense of direction it can be hard to fulfill your objective within the time given. 

I´m happy I played it but I will never touch it again once I complete the final mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112596020', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1616813676}
review:
GTA III is an extremly dated game that also has a horrible and weird port. Animations move quickly and choppy, like clouds and everything move faster than they should. Every car is broken and cant reverse except for cop cars which I will also let you know is hands down the best vehicle in the game. It moves insanely fast forwards and unlike any other car you can actually reverse in it. The shooting is horrible but it always has been. Not only did this game not age well but its port is quite horrible. Add that with bad driving, and shooting anyway and you see what was the first attempt at what we know the rest of the series as today. As this was the first GTA that wasnt top down and in a way arcade like.

4/10 - If the game ran correctly I'd give it a 5.1 point 1 for being a very game changing game for rockstar as it blew people away back when it came out.

review: Говно динозавра (даже не мамонта - первые два Фолача я стерпел, хоть и с третьего раза). Worst piece of trashy shit I ever experienced. In fact, it drove me so mad that I wouldn't post this otherwise - usually I'm too lazy to write a review (Geez, I'm so pissed off). No full map, no autosaves, when you have to rive thru' the whole stupid city all the damn time, no taxi (cab to fast-travel) and no mouse view in the car (it would prowe extremely useful), motherfucking mobsters shoot at you on site (even if you're in a vehicle) just the moment they see you and there's always a freaking bunch of 'em spawned nearly everywhere (each fucking time when I tried to complete one race mission and rode thru' damn spagetti guido turf - there ALWAYS would be an asshole with a shotgun who'd blow my fucking car away JUST WITH ONE GUCKING SHOT! That exact moment I wished I'd smash some dev's face with my monitor. And I had to restart, all over and over and over again! 8 times! It's fucking hillarious... I'd crush my mouse if I hadn't done it 3 days before! I have some patience in me, but when I left Portland I had to resort to cheats, becuz otherwise my ass would fly to the fucking moon. Stylistics of the game is unattractive and the radiostations all but one (K-JUH) are awful. And yet it would be tolerable, but when I reached 'Espresso-2-Go!' and simply couldn't destroy the pre-last kiosk, located downside, with a rocket launcher up from the bridge - becuz that stupid script required me to get closer - I eventually dropped that piece of garbage for good. The 2nd damn time!!! The previous one I haven't even had enough temper to get that far!!! P.S.: Yes, I DO realize it was released back in 2001 and it was an important part of the industry, but... I just can't get over it. It's no fun at all

author: {'steamid': '76561198078034751', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1616478599}
review:
[h1] Intro [/h1] 
The game didn't age well but I'd recommend it because I played it as a kid. I remember one of my friends bringing it on DVD to class with whole 1,2,3 trillogy. As I had a weak notebook it was one of the most played games for me before I got Vice City. "I'd recommend it" but I can't, not after Rockstar took down fan projects that reverse engineered the game engine to fix the game for modern PCs. Rockstar never did anything to make the game more playable on modern PCs, community had to make fixes themselves. And after they tried to fix this for all the fans out there, they got kicked in the a*s by Rockstar. If You wanna buy it just remember that.
[h1] Story [/h1] 
As for the game itself the story is medium. I liked most of the missions but the fact that Claude works for just anyone and doesn't care for previous employeers: SPOILER [spoiler] You work for Kenji just to kill him later by order from your new employee that wants to start a war, Claude doesn't care for Asuka - Kenji's sister that helped him after he got betrayed. [/spoiler] This was one of the biggest things that made me think that he's unloyal to anyone after he got betrayed himself twice. Some missions get irritating when You have to do it all over again 3 or 4 times BUT there's only a few of them. You can collect hidden packages to make it easier for Yourself as after every death You'll have a set of weapons next to Your hideouts.
[h1] There are mods and fixes: [/h1] 
As for the things that made some people really pissed and maybe they based their negative reviews out of these things too.
Can't get a mission done because You're lost on the map with the small radar? Download a map and HD radar mods.
Getting annoyed by the fact You can't rotate the camera while driving a vehicle? Download vehicle camera movement mod.
[h1]Annoying missions[/h1]
There are multiple missions that have a timer and they're one of the most annoying missions in the whole game BUT I can't agree that 'Espresso-2-Go' is "painstakingly difficult" as the timer starts when You destroy the first coffee stand. You can roam around all 3 islands to get all of the stands marked on Your radar. If You'll still have problems with that You can always install a map mod which I previously mentioned. Another mission that someone mentioned to be annoying and hard is "marked man" where You must cross to another island to the airport with a timer. Once again I can't agree with "It required you to go drive through a subway station at a random part of town." Most of the bridges between an islands are located not far away from the island borders (horizontally and vertically). After all previous missions You should be somehow familiar with the way islands are designed. Once again even if You have to retry that missions 2 or 3 times it's not a big deal. After failing it once or twice You can either aimlessly try it again on an instant or get prepared for it after You know how it will look like. It's really easy to get prepared properly after 1-3 failed tries and it'll save You more time. If You want to have easier time navigating through the islands just install a mod.
[h1] Summary [/h1]
I recommend the game but I don't recommend paying Rockstar for it. They didn't release any fixes for modern PCs and kicked the modders community in the a*s.
Edit: you can not purchase classic gta trillogy and have to pay 60$ for remake. Seeing the trailers of the remake it's not even worth buying. Characters look like they were cut from fortnite or sims and mere physics change does not justify the price and removing mods just to deliver this poor piece of crap.

review: I watched other kids play the old PS2 Grand Theft Auto games growing up and wanted to see if they were that good. I think it was pretty fun overall. You get to steal cars and run around shooting everything up. The controls could be a little frustrating and some missions could be frustrating too. It's not the best game I've ever played, but it's fun for what it is. I recommend picking it up on sale if you want to experience the beginning of the GTA franchise.

review: This game is good, if we lived back in 2000. I remember playing this as a kid and was crazy about it, just how fun it is and its still kinda fun but i believe that its because i have nostalgia for it. If youve never played this game, yes try it, its an amazing game for its time and for the price but just know that time and further GTAs have spoiled you and that this entry is the first 3D GTA.  with that, if you have played it, it might be fun but for me i realized that it was very barebones, same mission types, clunky controls, and a weird camera. but hey its a classic and try it out.

review:
Love the game still in 2021... ohh yeah, and I am playing for the first time. Sure i've roamed around our safehouse when i was a  kid but that's it. Still compelling. If you like Vice City, you'll like this.

EDITED AND ADDED ON 26th OCTOBER, 2021:
Well it's really hard to complete the game with all the hard-ass missions and going back again and again without a map. It's tough. So, I may or may not wait for the Definitive Edition (which has been announced and will be out in 17 days (DIGITAL). However this version does run fairly well. Like it looks HD. There are some bugs when you disable the frame limiter but that's just gonna be it. I know nobody can buy this anymore but I'm glad I have a copy of all the three original games with me. GAME PRESERVATION Y'ALL!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085009071', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2145, 'last_played': 1611110042}
review:
I'll review this for the Steam community since it's on sale

PROS:

- Great nostalgia trip

- Great game

- Great look back into gaming time, it was the first great open world game and first 3D GTA

- You can input cheats! NPCs fight! Cars explode! Gun cheats! Wanted Level cheats!

CONS:

- The game doesn't hold your hand through the missions. If you die, you have to go get your guns and armour back. Thankfully there are cheats you can input so that the game doesn't waste your time

- The Rockstar port is pretty bad. No bug fixes for the modern PC so it can be pretty annoying.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720574899
I HIGHLY recommend you look at a bundle of mods made by the community that enhances textures, adds things back in, and fixes things for the modern PC

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1962760372
I also recommend for those who want an experience similar to the PS2 to look at this guide. i suggest go through the guide section to find anything you like. But wait! Keep reading the review

- My game had times where it refused to open or would stay stuck open and I couldn't close it through Steam or task manager. Same point as above, it was ported poorly. This also goes for GTA Vice City as well! I've reviewed that too, in short for you the review is practically the same

SUMMARY (TL:DR)

- Good game
- Remember there's cheats
- Remember there's mods
- Remember you can rate the review helpful or award the review if it helped you! 

Thanks! And have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198869863461', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1607608891}

author: {'steamid': '76561198288512024', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1677342868}
review:
Nostalgia by the bucket load. Remember being blown away playing GTA3 when it first came out, man I feel old now. It was a landmark game, the open world game play, Rockstar became the poster boys for anti-censorship in gaming. That superb opening jazz track, which I've had on every MP3 player and phone since 2002!

Sure the 3D graphics look very dated by today's standards, the limited number of parts on the character's bodies looks so bad at times but the gameplay just makes this such a classic. One thing that does hit you is that in today's games you play off the two sticks, look on one stick and move on the other but GTA3 being nearly 20 years old use one stick for movement so you tend to run around in circles a lot to turn around, we just accepted it back then but now it feels quite uncomfortable to play like that, weird.

Downloaded onto latest patched Win10, worked perfectly although the menus are a little sluggish the game worked perfectly first time without any tweaks.

If you played it years ago and you can get on sale for a couple of quid, get it as it's still a great game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416338035', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1635012286}
review:
One classic.

Launched in 2001 GTA III is a game changer in the history of video games, it was the first GTA 3D and the most ambitious proposal for a game at that time.

Unfortunately the game currently does not work very well, especially on more current PCs and it was in order to solve this that I made a guide to improve it through mods:

  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2427963589

It's worth picking up to feel that longing for the PS2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035548963', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1429482124}
review:
Grand Theft Auto III is an important piece of video game history with a splendid atmosphere and influential enough to affect every AAA developer for the next decades.
However it is hard to get into without basic nostalgia goggles; Spartan, nigh-unfair difficulty, questionnable UI aesthetics, numerous bugs and lack of ease-of-life features made this game age poorly, but gave a strong base for sequels to shine.

review:
Extremely fun to play although mission difficulty can be frustrating; the open world design, despite being Rockstar North's first foray into 3D video games, is really enjoyable, and paired with the PC release's updated visuals over the PS2 original, it can look pretty good for a 2001 game. Soundtrack and as a whole the sound design compliments Liberty CIty's game environment really well. (Controls also vastly better than every other version of the game you can get i.e. PS2, PS4/5, mobile) 


Strong 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273897217', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1676203845}
review:
A classic GTA made for veterans because I consider GTA III as the most challenging title in the whole GTA franchise. The story is well written with cheesy lines and the level design is quite clever. Emphasises action driving over combat. Worth trying if you're hungry for vehicle games.

Comments:
1. If you have DirectX 9.0c installed, you should be able to run the game on Windows 10.
2. Save game file of GTA III original release will not work on the Steam version.
3. Sometimes, pausing the game may cause the mouse not responding. To solve this problem, just unpause the game (you may need a couple tries) and the mouse should work as usual.
4. Glitches encountered in this game
- The bulletproof Patriot SUV (which is acquired from one of the missions) disappears in the garage
- Completing D-Ice's missions and saving the game will cause his rivaling gang members to stop spawning, even if you start a new game. Hence, the coming new game will break. To avoid this glitch, I suggest skipping D-Ice's final mission OR play that mission anyway and skip saving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198890978784', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1614816457}
review:
After completing GTA Vice City,GTA III was next on my list.And before I even start let me clarify some things,this game is revolutionary it completely changed the way that open-world games were made and it set the tone for future GTA games,but it's also very complex experience at least for me.
Story: Story of GTA III is quest for revenge,it includes a lot of betraying and a lot of backstabbing.But apart from that it does not offer much.Characters to me are just walking stereotypes characters like Tony-Italian mafioso,Salvatore-clearly based on don Vito Corleone,and Kenji is just strict Japanese Yakuza member.Missions are entertaining and action packed,but it can also get very hard because of the game mechanics  
Gameplay-My biggest issue with GTA III gameplay was that it had no map so I always felt like I was lost and in some missions like infamous Espresso to go it can get extremely annoying.As with GTA Vice city I will divide this one into 32subcategories
                Driving-Well I guess it is as good as it can be in a game that is 20 years old.It can get clunky especially if you are driving faster cars,but you will get use to it eventually.Also major issue is that there is no motor bikes so that's a bad thing. Driving boats is even clunkier than in GTA Vice city
                Fighting-It is nearly the same as in GTA Vice city clunky,but it has a lot smaller variety of weapons available.  General setting-GTA III manages to capture dark atmosphere of the Liberty city's underworld,also it parodies a lot of bad stuff in American society.
In general,I would recommend this game,but I will warn you,arm yourself with patience because game can get really frustrating at times,it can be buggy,it can crash for no reason and some missions a really annoying.But all in all it is a good experience.

review: What can i say, an absolute ride thats for sure, this is a classic GTA game and really set the standard for open world story telling and world building. The cast is absolutely fantastic from Frank Vincent (Sopranos) to Joe Pantoliano (The Matrix). The game is very dated however it has its many flaws and I downloaded a mod GTA 3 Definitive edition to make it work better on modern hardware. The story isnt too long but the gameplay is quite unforgiving, you will find yourself fighting against the game to find exploits to abuse to pass through the levels. Overall however I would reccommend this game, its a brilliant and fantastic GTA and is a classic, I hope one day it is remastered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417991700', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1613906929}
review:
It was probably good in 2001. Having played through the whole thing in 2021 (my first time completing it, though not my first time playing it), I don't think it's aged well. By "completing" I mean doing all the main story missions, all the payphone missions, and collecting the hidden packages. Not bothering with the taxi stuff.

The AI vehicles often spawn in walls or crash into each other for no reason. I assume the developers were proud to figure out how to make the AI change lanes after four hours of caffeine coding, so they made all the AI vehicles change lanes every 5 seconds, not caring if that means they will crash into your car while you're driving at 120 miles per hour right past them (this is especially noticeable on the big bridges and in the tunnels). The game is not optimized for newer machines and assumes you are playing on a 1940s computer because cars will despawn when you look away from them if they're more than 5 meters away. If you play above 30Hz your car will not reverse in at least the first mission. And I had a problem with the menu options being too transparent when I started, don't remember how I fixed it though.

The story is okay but overrated. Ok, so Claude is a psychopath and will kill anyone as long as he gets money for it? Kinda lazy, I don't care for the guy at all. Much of the game, especially the third or so before the Mafia part, is just random "go do this for me" filler missions to make the game seem longer. And some of the missions are only available at certain times of day, so you just sit there on your phone until the in-game clock hits a certain time; fortunately, this only happens in Portland.

The game is very difficult to enjoy after you progress through most of the missions as random gang members all around the map will start shooting you. Yes, they even notice you if you're zooming past them in a vehicle, and your car blows up after taking a few bullets, in fact if you stub your toe against the car it will blow up. This makes many of the side missions needlessly difficult if you don't do them before the gang members turn hostile. It also makes most of the map unexplorable, especially the north half of Portland where you will just be insta-killed by angry Mafia members with shotguns. Speaking of the map, you don't actually get a map. You're supposed to "get used to it and memorize the city" as some bitter old man who I am paraphrasing said online when I looked up where I'm supposed to buy guns (it's not marked on the mini-map), yeah let me memorize the whole city with a squad of gang guys every 10 feet shooting at me. Prepare to use Google images a lot.

And the game just hasn't aged that well. You can't turn your camera while driving, I guess that's alright since there are buttons to reverse the camera and look at a fixed 90 degree left and right view but it takes a while to get used to. The guns are almost humorously inaccurate, you can aim a shotgun at someone from a few feet away and take four shots before you actually hit them once. And I am talking about alcohol shots because this game will make you a depressed alcoholic. At least one of the assault rifles rapid fires an accurate straight line of bullets, but they go slightly above and to the right of the cross-hair. If you die, you will lose all the guns you paid for, but that's okay because all you need to do is collect 100 hidden packages so the guns spawn at your safehouse, but don't worry, the game won't tell you which ones you've collected so if you use a guide and miss one you have to go through all of them again, just to complete some of the harder missions without contemplating premature real life expiration because of the lack of a sniper rifle. I should also add that, if you die at any point in a mission, you have to restart the mission from scratch, and I mean from the hospital walking all the way back to the mission giver. Great stuff!

The only good things I will give this game are the selection of music and the world design. But the world design doesn't even matter because you can't explore it without constantly being shot by the Colombian cartel.

So, I'm going to not recommend it, unless you fall into one of the following three groups: (1) old-school GTA fans who want to play the mediocre game they remember only through their flawed nostalgia glasses, (2) completionists like me who just want to play through every GTA game when they could be doing something more productive instead, (3) GTA VI developers who are required by Rockstar to play this so they know how to not make a GTA game. Note that fitting into one these groups does not mean you will actually enjoy the game.

Anyway I hope Vice City is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296098509', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1614112155}
review:
Before we start, this game is very old and runs into trouble running on modern computers.  Luckily, the entire game has been reverse-engineered through the re3 project with tons of fixes and improvements added.  You can download it here: (removed it because it got DMCA'd and I don't wanna get in trouble)

Now onto the review.  This game is awesome!  GTA3 is not a childhood game of mine so I went into this without any nostalgia clouding my eyes and I still think it's great.  The world of GTA3 feels so alive for a game of its time and the missions are very fun.  This game goes on sale often and for very cheap so if you haven't played this game I would wait for it to go on sale.

ALSO A NOTE: On the mission "a drop in the ocean", the boat the mission wants you to use may be glitched and unusable.  You'll have to find a different boat.  I took a police boat and completed the mission just fine with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076755073', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2803, 'last_played': 1675661025}
review:
Fantastic little game. Not too long. Gotta respect one of the first to pull it off successfully. Didn't age that well, but still: bravo. This was a negative review before, because Rockstar sold this in an unplayable state that required mods to work. If the community can make it work for free using their own time, Rockstar, who used to profit from this, should HAVE to make it work. Their obligation, pure and simple, or just don't sell the game. Like they're doing with Trilogy Definitive Edition: that garbage sucks and it's their duty to make it playable.
Back to this one: I really enjoyed it even though it's hard and sometimes a bit clunky. Cheated a lot to enhance the experience a bit, or else I'd have to give the game up. Can't wait to play more from the franchise!
Score: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198846466706', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1647662335}
review: A game that easily shows its age as it suffers from a variety of poorly designed missions and the general lack of cohesion seen in many games today. Some players may also take notice of the game's dated stereotypes towards certain ethnic groups and find them offensive, which is another major aspect of this game that holds it back from being a timeless masterpiece, as this game has a difficult time separating social satire from these negative attitudes. In conclusion, this game acts a stepping stone for what would become one of the best selling video game franchises ever made and can be seen as a noteworthy relic of the early 2000's. 6.3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198322976564', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1672128017}
review:
Download this first BEFORE YOU BUY:
- CLEO Plugins: https://cleo.li/
- Silent Patch (+DDraw): https://silent.rockstarvision.com/uploads/SilentPatchIII.zip
- WideScreenFix: https://github.com/ThirteenAG/WidescreenFixesPack/releases/tag/gta3
- G-Input 1.11: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TYK5sHyoW4684Zw6Lfq73gINpAcYRoND/view?usp=sharing

Back in my PS2, this game is a masterpiece. This port however is....well, I'm gonna explained the whole sh!t needed and such on why this game is a cult masterpiece. You'll play as Claude, a htiman who ties his neck for every organize crime to kill your b!tch ex-girlfriend to exact your revenge. It's GTA, so you know what. Killing people, blowing stuff up, driving here and here, car racing, that kinda sh!t.

For nostalgic reason, this game is fun, but g0ddamn the amount of work of getting this game to bloody work required about an hour just to make sure, you don't crash or f@#ked up here and compatibility stuff. Naturally, it makes you a modder working on that stuff up.

If you plan on purchasing this game, I recommend to BOUGHT THIS WITH THE TRILOGY BUNDLE and download the patch above I put. However, if you don't like to work on doing this stuff, you can get it by purchasing it via Rockstar Game Launcher (like you give a sh!t about it), or play it on f@#k!ng console. But yeah, Rockstar Game Launcher still has a Widescreen Issues, so, the patch above is STILL REQUIRED.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198840439096', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2065, 'last_played': 1637870473}
review:
I wish there was a So-so option when reviewing steam games. However, since I did have a few good memories when playing this game, I'll leave a thumbs up. 

Anyways, GTA III is the first 3d installment in the GTA franchise, so it was really impressive seeing rockstar being able to have a 3d open world experience where exiting and entering cars were a thing. Obviously the game has aged pretty poorly. The shooting mechanics are awful, the driving could be way better (you can't turn your camera when driving), the story was decent, and the movement is kinda awkward(your character will always turn in the direction of the mouse). However, I think the main selling point back then was the fact that this game had ALL of these things, and even today I think it's pretty cool, as the game offers a nice simulation of reality as a sandbox. You are able to commit crimes and have cool chases with the police although the drive-by controls only allow you to shoot left or right. The thing I didn't like about GTA 3 is how some missions felt tedious as some were just violent chores for the mafia or whatnot. I guess the main reason to buy GTA  3 would be to experience the decent story or have a simplistic GTA environment where cops are a bit more tough.

The bottom line: I would recommend GTA 3 on a sale or buying it with the GTA trilogy pack.

review:
let's see...
no full map which is horrible
the shooting is absolute garbage
the missions are absolute hell
no map legends whatsoever
mate, how the fuck can i buy a gun if i don't know where the fucking place is

i don't think i can play this game without cheat
hell, even i can finish GTA:SA and GTA:VC without it

well... i guess it's because Rockstar first 3D game

but, i can't recommend this game to anyone else
if you want to play earlier GTA games i suggest you should play Vice City instead of this mess

oh yeah, one last thing... you need to patch this game by yourself... yeah....

after i finished the game i still won't change my opinion on it
it's aged and not in the good way

for someone who had tasted the modern GTA4 and GTA5 this game will punish you and it will punish you hard

and the fun in GTA:SA and GTA:VC is not available in this game

for someone who want to play this game just for the sake of playing all 3D era of GTA games, this game will feels like a chore rather than to have fun

but, if you still want to play the game the community got you covered https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720574899

and with that i'm gonna play Vice City next. bye

author: {'steamid': '76561198100877724', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1613088372}
review:
The graphics are great for it's generation and the open world is an inovation that guided the world of triple A productions. Although all the good things, the game is quite boring. The missions are not so creative, it's like every mission it's the same with a little variable that turns into a plothole. Sometimes you help the mafia by killing a bunch of his enemys, other time you are working for Yakusa and killing their enemies. When you do it for the first time, it's awesome, but when you start to advance in the game, it feels so repetitive, but it's understandable.
Some other aspects that I think adds to this sense of boredom: The musics in the radio are so forgettable. It's seems like just some generic songs in some genres. The Jah radio has like, three songs? It all sound the same, and it works for every genre (minus the main theme, the main theme is AWESOME!)
In conclusion, the game it's fun, a milestone in the history of gaming but, in my opinion, didn't passed the test of time.


Note: PC Version

{'steamid': '76561198265210224', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1615530387}
review: Another God tier game from Rockstar. Story is great, although as someone who never played this as a kid (San Adreas and vice city were my firsts), seeing Catalina as pure evil feels kinda outa character. Still story is great and characters are well fleshed out. Unfortunately like the rest of Rockstar's ports, this game has a lot of bugs (which can be fixed using silent patch). But unlike the other gta games, the gameplay and game code/logic definitely hasn't aged well. It's hard to describe it, but compared to other gtas the game mechanics feel much more simplistic (but not in a good way), peds aren't as good as the other games, vehicle damage from bullets is hard to tell etc. Ofc, it is the oldest 3d universe gta game, and it was very revolutionary at the time for what it had, and even 20 yrs later this game had more substance than alot of new triple A shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211736829', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1611470831}
review: This is one of the most classic and childhood GTA game that I played. And it brings me back my memories! I used to love playing this game till I experience some issue. The issue was that this game keeps on crashing me and I don't mean that the game completely froze on me. Everytime when I decide to play this game, sometimes out of nowhere, the game will minimize itself and takes me back to my desktop menu. When I try to go back, it keeps on minimizing and takes me back to my desktop menu. I have tried numerous time to fix the issue, but I found none. My graphic card isn't the problem (I have NVIDIA GeForce). I will normally give this game a good rating, but with the issue that I experience, I will give it nope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424330368', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1610711445}

review: Started replaying this in January 2021 and I'm having a blast. I do recommend the HD mod you can find online, improves the game a ton. Fair warning though with guns like the sniper and rocket launcher the Classic Axis breaks it. If you remove the 2 classic axis files the snipers and rocket launcher are fixed but aiming with other guns is frustrating. So if you know you are gonna use the sniper or rocket launcher in a mission remove the files but put them back whenever you don't plan on using the sniper or rocket launcher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097889042', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1617542916}
review:
This is my first real encounter with the GTA series and, as someone who doesn't care much for the "run around and cause mayhem" gameplay, I found the game to be good enough for short bursts of time. Lack of a map was a big detriment and I gave up on finishing the game, because some of the missions towards the end were really annoying.

Edit: Went back to the game after finishing San Andreas and installing the Definitive Mod, still, the final missions were sometimes very frustrating. GTA III is worth checking out for being the first 3D GTA game, but move on to the next games if you end up not liking this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963776375', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1671308759}
review: You have to mod this game otherwise text is hard to read, and I've also read that the game will have many other issues if it isn't modded. Also, the save system is really bad and the game has you doing certain missions that are extremely difficult, no fun, and frustrating that require a lot of repetition. You are only allowed to save at a certain location, so instead of getting to pick up right where you need to in order to try and get the mission right, you have to restart from a remotely located save point and then you have to repetitively and monotonously travel to the area where you need to start the mission again. Also, the character you play has absolutely no personality whatsoever unlike later GTA's.

review: In my opinion, this is the best way to experience GTA 3 today. The controls are great on PC. I used to play this game when I was younger on Playstation 2, and the game was a little bit too difficult, but on the PC, I may finally complete this game, after so many years since my time playing it as a kid. I would definitely recommend this to any fan of the old school GTA games. It's a nostalgic trip down memory lane, and it takes me back to a simpler time when the world wasn't so crazy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044340901', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1613563159}
review:
The bad:  

The menu is somewhat broken with the text not being displayed at all, after a few seconds it will show up, but the text is transparent and hard to see for some reason.  This is only in the beginning at start when trying to load a game, etc. In game the text normal. 

2nd, Controllers for PC are atrocious and not fully able to be customized. In addition things don't work like aiming, driving and shooting (hit or miss? though it shouldn't even be a hit or miss situation to begin with). You definitely will need a pad for this to have a good time.

3rd, and it's the biggest one for me, if you have dual monitors, the game doesn't lock the mouse in game and as soon as you click the game will minimize. Having to worry about this and happen to you through out the game makes it completely unplayable for me.  

To avoid the major issues like keyboard and snapping your screen closed, if you have a game pad it solves all those problems.

(update: Even with a game pad the game doesn't work right).

The good:

It plays just like remembered,  feels a lot better than the ps2 port, and is a lot of fun. It fulfills nostalgia, and IS fun.
Doesn't seem require much out of a machine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087310281', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1611281158}
review: As soon as i heard the intro music, the nostalgia of playing it on PS2 when it first came out hit me.  I wanted to explore again, find those hidden packages!  Let's look at the map!..why can't I...yep.  That's right.  They didn't start giving you the expanded map view until Vice City.  Oh nostalgia, dammit.  Atleast I can get 125 health from the Gumby prostitutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998824356', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1609390614}
review:
Edit: Take-Two Interactive is a stupid company, taking down mods for old GTA.

I played this using the Definitive Edition mod you can find in the community guide.

Fun game. Story is straightforward gang betrayal, but still enjoyable.

Some missions are challenging, but doable. I had to plug in my mouse for the sniper mission.

I thought the place was that small considering it's the first in the 3D series, until Staunton Island happened. Not bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319163440', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1609467217}
review:
Don't get me wrong, this game is a classic. The first GTA on the 3D universe. 

However, the gameplay isn't worth nowadays (aiming is just horrible) and most of the missions are boring.

Well, Rockstar had to start from somewhere. Give this game a try if you love the GTA franchise

author: {'steamid': '76561198060898907', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1653763006}
review: I've been playing this game since it released back in the day on ps2. This entire franchise keeps me playing these classics at least once a year with a full play through. That's just story line, no multiplayer on these. That's how ahead of the times this game was when it released. Going back playing it today on my new rig, I love it more with the second load times and ultra smoothness I've never seen on my playstations. If you never got to play this game when it 1st released but really want to check out where GTA 3d modeling began, or are just a fan of GTA you need this for your steam collection, even if it's just a once a year play.  I still remember that day playing for the 1st time with my friends, doing some missions, taking a break and trying to hit that wanted level cap then back to missions. Vice City is next

author: {'steamid': '76561198361751323', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1677538031}
review:
Grand Theft Auto 3 was the first GTA game I ever played, back when I was 10 years old. Now that I'm 20 I came back to play all of the old GTA games for nostalgia and am having an absolute blast.

Being one of the older GTA games there are some very noticeable differences right off the bat, features that are missing in the newer GTA games:

- First of all, there's no full map screen you can pull up, or GPS to help you get to your destination. Just a dot on the bottom left of the minimap that you have to drive to, meaning you have to drive around and get familiar with the city to know where you're going. There's lots of useful things spread out around strategic points on the map you can use to help you out, like health kits, losing wanted stars when being chased by police, the locations of gun stores, secret minigames or other powerups that reward you for exploring and knowing where everything is by experience.

- Second, there's no cover system, you cant crouch or hide behind low walls meaning the combat is very run and gun and can be pretty difficult at times.

- Third, if you die at all you lose ALL of your guns and start again with nothing but your fists but you get a ton of money from the story missions meaning you can very easily pick up more gear by buying it, killing NPCs with weapons or finding weapon spawned around the map. It's very important to save between missions so you can reload your gear if you die.

- That brings me to the missions. The missions are very short and sweet, most of them take around 5 minutes or less and are pretty simple (the game is from 2001 after all games were more simple then), but they are action packed and fun, and each mission manages to be different than the last. They can also be very difficult at times, I couldn't complete them as a kid but coming back as an adult I can usually clear them after failing the first few times and getting the hang of it.

- There are lots of things you can do besides the main story: fight in gang wars, get in shootouts with the police, work as a vigilante police officer, paramedic, taxi driver or fire fighter to earn money, participate in street races, find various minigames with lots of replay value and other secrets around the map, or just drive around and go on a crime spree, it is GTA after all.

GTA 3 was the very first 3D Grand Theft Auto game. This game is an absolute classic and though it lacks the features of newer games and even games that came only a few years after it like San Andreas, GTA 3 still possesses that beloved Grand Theft Auto feeling to it and at the time completely revolutionized what an open-world game was and changed videogames FOREVER, a true piece of gaming history and a must play if you are a Grand Theft Auto fan.

review: I played this game while waiting for "This War of Mine" to download. Minutes turned into hours, and before I knew it, I stayed up all night playing this game, and well after "TWoM" should have finished downloading. Liberty city feels like a real place, even if the graphics haven't aged very well, and beating the life out of a hooker with a baseball bat until she drops her money for you to take and spend on weapons is surprisingly cathartic (in game of course).

author: {'steamid': '76561198245885710', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1652627854}
review:
игра детства.
не для широкой публики. Если у вас нет ностальгии, лучше поиграть во что-то ещё. Всё-таки 2020+ год на дворе. 

плюсы :
 - приятная езда на машинах
 - не картонное поведение окружения, часто происходит какой-то контент, без твоего участия.
 - атмосферная, запоминающаяся музыка
 - ощутимая сложность. 
 - неуспевающие надоесть, разнообразные, для ограниченного функционала миссии

минусы: 
 - главный герой - амеба. Не вызывает сопереживания. Делает всё, что попросят. 
 - безликие персонажи
 - персонаж не умеет плавать, нет полетов
 - нельзя двигать камерой во время езды / нельзя посмотреть полную карту ( без патчей по крайней мере )

review: Great game if you want some of that early 2000s nostalgia, but if you only want to play an older GTA, you'd be better off playing vice city or san andreas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198967888189', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 12998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12998, 'last_played': 1607961028}
review:
There are few gamers who have not played at least one of the parts of Grand Theft Auto. Few elsewhere could one cough up missions and the associated linear progression through play, and simply indulge in the endless murder of people and the demolition of cars.

GTA 3 is a very believable explanation of how things work in the underworld and that money and respect are far from being earned by honest work alone.
You could say that it's a simulator of life in a pretty decent city from the point of view of a criminal, and Liberty City doesn't have its name just for fun, because if we take away some of the natural barriers, you can do whatever you like in it.

For me, this was my first GTA and I wanted to play it again in Steam, not only because I'm a collector, but also as a tribute to this great series of games.
If you are not afraid to enter a world that is more aggressive and ruthless than anything else, keep going, because this game is worth it. [b] 70% [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198300084300', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1607800004}
review:
Although it's a very old game, it's still painful to play. I played this game just because this was the only GTA game in my library that I haven't completed.

I couldn't follow the storyline. I didn't even know what was happening other than Catalina's betrayal. Missions mostly ask you to kill someone and I really don't know why. The absence of the map view was a huge mistake too. I spent my time finding my way.

I take it as due to its development time, the A.I. is terrible. Especially the only thing cops do is to hit your car until you die and burn in the fricking hell.

The missions themselves are also already making it harder to play. As the enemies may be able to shoot and explode your car very easily. There isn't even a proper in-game guideline of how to finish those missions when needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065261504', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 7511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4313, 'last_played': 1642629335}
review:
It's a bit broken, but... then again, that can be said for all ported GTAs, so, eh
I did had a lot of fun, even made a skin for myself! I wonder why they didn't mantained that? I mean, the personality of the characters wouldn't change, but their clothes/ hairdos could, y'know?

Also, quite the saving grace having a User-Made Track; the music there are good, but they do repeat more than other games, due to the lack of money to buy the license of more songs
Also, nowadays, it's quite noticeable how "in-development" it looked, with patches of terrain with absolutely nothing, not even a tree or a bush; but it's quite nderstandable because of the time. I actually liked that a lot because, as a depressed game developer, seeing that things can look somewhat unfinished or rushed can still look good, iconic even, for a ton of people: you just need to pour your heart on it and work hard <:D

[strike]Also Donald Love looked like a professor of mine >.>[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198132031070', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1641338675}
review:
Arguably if not indeed better on personal computer than the consoles that made it (in)famously successful, GTA III is the groundbreaking open world classic that still holds up due to its dark imagination and consideration of what goes into basically introducing a game genre to a worldwide audience.

The control scheme and camera is far more efficient and less frustrating than the original PS2 release and the allowance of mods like your custom radio station makes it a superior way of exploring the original Liberty City. While it is arguably the most visually aged 3D GTA title, it has a strange charm that seems all but unique to its series and  acts as a fun time capsule to life and culture in America 2001 through the satirical lens of British developer Rockstar.

That it can still illicit an unique feel despite being practically the starting point of the open-world sandbox is a testament to how ingenious GTA III was and is. It may not have all the refinements of later GTAs or other sandboxs down the road, but it can still impress when you consider all it does and allows you for a game nearly 20 years old.

The best way to experience Claude's unforgettable criminal journey is not with a controller but with mouse and keyboard. Now get out there and experience a controversial but extremely important piece of not just gaming history but entertainment/ art history. It's that big a deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995728114', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 3200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3200, 'last_played': 1589254893}
review: It's very obviously dated. It's the middle ground between the random missions you got in the original GTA without any narrative context, and the story driven gameplay that would begin to take over with Vice City. Mind-blowing for its time, but today stands as a prototype that is nowhere near as sophisticated as what is the norm in the industry today.

review:
I used to play this game non-stop as a kid on the PS2.

Oh, how my 6-year-old self used to take pleasure in torturing random pedestrians and committing ungodly crimes that would make some of the most violent criminals in the world cringe.

Fun times.

Oh yeh, and the music's pretty good too.

review: It's not an ideal game. There are tons of technical limitations due to console nature of original release. There were too many shortcuts taken during development. Hell, objectively looking in comparison to other well-known titles of same era it's not even that good. BUT! It captures the time so well giving you a taste of what gaming was in the early 2000s. Therefore GTA3 holds special place in mind of many players. Inculding me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258467884', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1605902404}
review:
This game is decent. It doesn't overstay its welcome with an adequate game length.

The problems it does have are due to it being a product of its time, and some music tracks have been removed due to license expirations.

Its still worth a revisit in 2020, however a lightly modded experience is probably the way to go, to give the game a new coat of paint. Bugs will happen with newer hardware however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330457092', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1619250022}
review: Bought this game only for nostalgia purpose and it’s pretty cheap if you buy the trilogy pack during sales. It’s a very old game so you need to use the "Hd fix" mod to play without any issues in modern pc. Also make sure to turn on the frame limiter option from settings because this game was not made to run at more than 60 fps back than. So even if you have a high end pc make sure to turn on that frame limiter option otherwise you will face some weird bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996644633', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 3043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1670264607}
review:
Stepping into the 3D realm never felt so good!

Graphically this title has aged but with grace, still pleasing to look at and has that 'feel good' retro vibe.

Soundtrack is awesome! Great songs, unique DJs, hilarious commercials!

Storyline is intuitive and engaging.

Overall this title is a must play for anyone into the GTA series, even if you had started at GTA-V. This is a great testament to where most open world shoot-em-ups base their ideas on!

Get this at full price!
