author: {'steamid': '76561198070923312', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 7730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1643447165}
review:
The game is freaking fantastic, it comes with a manual link on Steam which still works in perfectly easy downloadable format for all the GTA goodies you'd get buying a DVD of the game on PC or PS2 or what-have-you, and among other things, just an impressive piece of tech and a great game!!!

As a matter of fact, I'm having so much fun with the rest of the game, I currently barely made it to Staunton Island just from how much freeroaming mayhem and things there are to do in the game!!! New York City feels lifelike (for the time anyway), streets, visuals and sound effects capturing almost perfectly what Manhattan, Brooklyn and Staten Island feel like although all 3 are "misnamed".

It's a fantastic game, I can't say it enough, and a must-play as are its followers, Vice City, San Andreas, Grand Theft Auto 4 and GTA 5! Really cool stuff! 

I would even recommend you to check out Grand Theft Auto 1 and 2 if you really enjoy 3 for what it is, since 1 and 2 are A LOT like your experience with this game in a lot of ways, and equally detailed/flush with attention to detail and mechanical soundness!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127555502', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1634309009}
review:
Bought because of nostalgia mainly, its a classic and if you are a fan of GTA you gotta check this out.
I had to install Silent Patch because I had some bugs with the menu, not something too big but worth the mention
A little something I think is important to point out: this didn't age very well, the game feels weird to play because of its primitive mechanics, such as no map except for little radar, no custom waypoints and no checkpoints.
But for its time, a masterpiece.
Buy for nostalgia, or if you are hardcore GTA fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041891241', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1583015885}
review:
Okay, so... The controls are really, really bad! The game is littered with graphical bugs and it often crashes. A very well known bug is that the game wont even start, how ever there are work arounds to start the game.

I've poured hundreds if not thousands of hour into this game on Playstation 2 back when it first came out and enjoyed myself, but in todays standards the game just doesn't hold up. It's a bad port and Rockstar should feel bad about it. Better yet, they should fix it!.... Maybe they'll add shark cards to it?... Nevermind Rockstar. Please proceed to work on Grand Theft Horse 3, or whatever you're up to these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128099629', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2567, 'last_played': 1596284963}
review:
Fun at the right price.  Not as refined as its sequels: Glitchy, annoying at times, and not user-friendly.  But overall, especially if you're a fan of the series, it's worth picking up if the price is right.

Just make sure you don't fudge yourself out of 100% completion by not doing the Ambulance mission first (unless you don't care about getting 100%!)...

review:
Honestly still a good game, graphics are dated but then even back in the day they were not trying to be cutting edge just 3D and working, worst thing about the game is the main menu interface, all settings are manual so it defaults to 640x480 resolution, the game needs a basic modernisation update, to keep the game relevant and selling on Steam, along with Vice City and they need to port Stories over to Steam as well, nothing too fancy, just a update to the main game system files to allow better user experience and keep the game working on Win 10 and beyond, they could call it a Legacy Edition. 
in any case, the game still works and is still fun play

author: {'steamid': '76561198140251355', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2023, 'last_played': 1581560335}
review:
Recommended.

If there is one word in my opinion that defines GTA III, this word is: Classic.

This is an almost 20 year old game, but somehow it doesn't show it's age through the graphics or the mechanics.

As the first 3D gta game, it somehow burdens the sequences, even the ones that are supposed to happen on the past, as San Andreas. They took some of the good things, but they also applied the bad ones too. 

Heck, the paramedic missions may have caused severe PTSD on some serious gamers all around... and they put the # level system in almost every single sequel too... 

The mod community also made some work for this title, making it feel more modern in some aspects. From HD textures to achievement system.

If you're a fan of the GTA franchise, give it a try, see where everything started, you won't regret it.

Story - 3
Gameplay - 4
Scenario - 3
Sync - 4
Sense - 2

Final - 3.2/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197977211906', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1581361650}
review:
I had this game for PS2 as a kid and loved it, it was my first real experience with an open world game. Unfortunately the DVD got all scratched up before I could have the chance to beat it. I saw a GTA bundle on sale on Steam recently and decided to get it again.

It's every bit as good now as it was back then, and still good compared to GTA games of today. There's a decent story with fun missions, some are pretty hard. Collecting hidden packages and doing side mission gives you so many powerups that you can end up tanking you way through hard missions if you need to. It's full of easter eggs, and the funny moments that makes GTA what it is.

I really recommend looking up the guide for the GTA III fixed version. It's a series of community made fixes and addons that have been packaged together. It updates the game with higher resolution textures and models from the PS2, XBOX and Mobile version as well as fixes problems with aiming, camera angles and other stuff Rockstar seemed to have ignored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075906052', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1580855136}
review: Legends say claude is still smiling till this day

author: {'steamid': '76561197980537163', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1583965764}
review:
The first truely 3D Grand Theft Auto title, this gem is where it all took off! It still holds up well today and is very playable, offers a lot of fun and is a must for any true fan of the series. The story is not as engaging as later titles such as GTA:SA. GTA 4 or GTA 5, but the game still has you chasing the next mission one after another.

I would recommend the various fixes, patches and improvements provided on the PCGaming Wiki page for this title. Make sure to set the "Frame Limiter" setting to "On" in the Display settings, otherwise you will encounter some game breaking bugs. The game runs very well on practically any hardware, including netbooks and laptops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198954778483', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1582953811}
review:
Still a great game in 2020 on Windows 10!  
Had to do some serious customization for the controller, but it works, kind of clunky tho.

So this game has some issue with the aiming where if you aim in the middle of the crosshair your bullets will travel up and to the right of what your aiming at.  I just saw that there is a fix online for that issue, but I did not try it.   
Also, if you experience a bit of lag as I did in the beginning of the game, try to check the audio driver in the settings of the game and select one of the other options.  It eliminated the lag entirely.

All in all, to have a chance to go back in time and play one of the games that changed the way we play certain games and introduce a more adult vibe in video games.  I still had a blast going back and reliving this game once more.  Adding the Custom soundtracks to the game to have my own music playing was nice.  The radio channels in GTA 3 bring quite a bit of humor to the table. 

Would I recommend this game to a friend:  Yes.
What do I rate this game                              4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198155533431', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 3190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1660385808}
review:
This game aged like fine milk, but it was a huge step forward for the franchise at the time. This game feels like more of an experience than an actual game. Still alright though, gameplay is generally quite fun. Only real problems stem from how new the 3D mechanics and physics were at the time, the team didn't quite know how to go about it and, as a result, the game can be very unstable. But hey, it brought us the [spoiler]flying tank[/spoiler], so there's that. If you loved this game back in the day, you'll still love it. And if you're a GTA fan, this is worth giving a try.

By the way, if you want to 100% complete the game, there's a few missions you should try to avoid doing before doing everything else there is to do. Some that come to mind are Sayonara Salvatore and The Exchange. In some cases it can make completion of the game impossible, such as with the firetruck missions. If you want to do all the story missions anyway, then you can simply tone down the aggressiveness of the gangs in the pedstats.dat file in the data directory of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020577507', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1580924753}
review: Practically the first game in the saga that became a radical change in the game system. The story, the plot, the missions and the environment make this little gem a must-have game for every collector (since it is a collector's item).

author: {'steamid': '76561198072428233', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1580927121}
review:
If you're looking to play this game for nostalgic reasons you could probably have a decent time playing it. If not, I really can't recommend this game. 

First of all the game requires patching in order for it to run correctly. Not difficult to do but an extra step to be able to play nonetheless. Unfourtunately, even when you get to play the game it is extremely bare-bones. Story is bad, storytelling is bad, characters are forgettable and replaced frequently and many missions are designed very poorly making them very frustrating to play and unrewarding when you complete them. 

I played through all of the main story and also did some side/secret missions mainly because I want to play and finish all GTA games from 3 and forward. Had this not been the case I probably wouldn't have finished the game.

review:
personally im soooo bored playing it. i just wanted to go back to this game because of nostalgia, but its soo boring plus some missions you get the cops on you and its absolutely chaos, 2 stars and you get rammed left and right, you cant stop without getting shot. if you wanna know the story of this franchise (of this game/gta3) you should most likely watch youtube videos.

November 11th 2020 edit: lol okey, i thought someone else wrote this and i kinda disagree. lemme clarify, i agree with the statements i had, but i also feel like it should be taken into account how old this game is. yes this game has some problems, and yes you should probably watch yt videos for the story. but for a die hard fan of gta, you should endure and play this game for the experience, and for someone that wants to play "older" generation games, you should give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333930623', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1586001519}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985409325', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1580141392}
review:
GTA 3 has been the most revolutionary GTA game ever made so far. However, Rockstar did not fix the game to adjust the game to today's standards. Unfortunately, this means you need to do it yourself.

[b]pros[/b]
++ the radio station chatterbox is the favourite in any GTA game
+ influential and revolutionary game. all GTA games after GTA 3 vastly copied the formula and has been used by other games as well
+ gunplay
+ graphics
+ performance
+ blood and gore
+ decent ending

[b]cons[/b]
- presentation is rather weak with bare-bone characters and mission introduction
- the camera lags behind the car's turning, making incoming traffic hard to see
- terrible timed missions
- no map. sure, there is the mini-map, but you will never know how far away the objectives are

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
GTA 3 can still be recommended to play the game if some fixes are applied. However, if you have not played any old GTA yet, I'd probably recommend you to check out Vice City first since it comes with a much better presentation.

Genre: action-adventure
Replay value: average
Rating: 7.25/10
Recommendation: Yes
Special endorsement: No

[b]Guide to fix the game[/b]
1. visit this page https://gtaforums.com/topic/669045-silentpatch/
2. download and drop the content "DDraw Component" and "SilentPatchIII" into your GTA 3 data folder
3. visit https://steamcommunity.com/app/12100/discussions/0/1699415798780663072/ . choose one of this fixes and drop the file into your GTA  3 data folder. this allows for 60 FPS in the game
4. enforce 60 FPS of frames in the nvidia inspector. disable all frame limiters in-game in the settings
5. shoot at walls to see if your aim is off. putting widescreen to off might fix the aiming issues if you have any
6. ???
7. profit

author: {'steamid': '76561198023594352', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8004, 'last_played': 1590529695}
review:
GTA 3 is one of those games I just can't stop going back to. It's one of my few "comfort games" where I've been playing it since I was 5, and I'll be playing it until I'm 50. I have such a fascination with the setting of Liberty City and how it's portrayed in this game, the pacing, the soundtrack, the story. It's all bundled together into such a tightly interwoven package that when you've finally finished it, it's impossible to leave feeling anything but satisfied. The blue and green, hazy, adrenaline-pumped Y2K symphony of chaos is unlike anything else ever made, and scratches an itch deep in my brain like nothing else quite can.

I have a bit of a crush on this game for a strange reason: It's one of the few games that game out very close to the turn of the millennium, when I was born. It gives me a sort of nostalgia for an era I just barely missed. Others include Deus Ex and to some degree, Metal Gear Solid 2. I've found myself to be very fascinated with American culture from about 1998-2002, and this fits just neatly in, released only a single month after the world-shaking events of 9/11, and only that long due to the fact that Rockstar's offices were quite close to ground zero.

Looking back on GTA 3 just over 18 years later, it's clear to me that this game will continue to stand amongst my most played and most loved for the rest of my life, and that it does and will continue to align with the rest of the GTA 3D trilogy as a master-crafted period piece. Vice City in the 80s, San Andreas in the 90s, and 3 in the 2000s. This game was a fantastic product of its time and environment which could not possibly be replicated today. We're not in the same world anymore. This is one of the last pre 9/11 pieces of entertainment ever made, and it is in my opinion, Rockstar's greatest ever accomplishment and should be played by anyone with a knack for open-world chaos.

And if you think it doesn't run on modern PCs, you just don't know what you're talking about. Turn the frame limiter on, people. It's just as playable as it was in 2002.

review:
GTA 3 is a fun sandbox game.
It's an very important game for video game history.
Even tho GTA 3 is a good game there are many problems.

I would say that the biggest problems are the driving physics, the time limits on some of the missions are too short and of course the fact that your vehicle explode when it lands upside down.

Good things.
As I said this is a fun sandbox. There are a decent amount of thing to do and stuff to find and of course great cheats.
I grew up with this game so it will always have a place in my heart.

Thanks for reading.

review: Grand Theft Auto III is fantastic. The missions are unreasonably and horrendously difficult at times, but maybe that's just because I suck at PC games. I like the vibe. It's kind of grungy, like Seattle in 1991, but instead it's Liberty City in 2001. I like Claude. He's a cool character. author: {'steamid': '76561198826964375', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1702, 'last_played': 1577688946}
review:
Listen, ive loved and beat every GTA game except the first 2 and the "Stories" series. Ive always heard about how 3 is easily the worst due to the difficulty and clunk. Im not saying its a bad game, but wow this game drastically rises in difficulty almost to the point of it being unplayable once you reach the 3rd island. How there was never a patch to increase vehicle durability is beyond me, some sections dont seem to be play tested. EX: I almost quit 100 percenting this game when i did a rampage that required 20 people to be ran over. 20 gang members with guns that blow up your vehicle in 5 bullets. How are you supposed to complete that?? Well luckily for me i remembered i had a bulletproof vehicle that was gifted to me during an earlier mission making it a breeze. Problem is players can easily lose this vehicle or destroy it due to vehicle's poor durability. 

Another thing is how fragile these vehicles are and how wildly inconsistent the damage dealt is. There are times when i'll run head first into a wall full speed and be smoking white (low damage) yet sometimes i'll simply get pit maneuvered and bam my vehicles on fire...from a pit maneuver? Ok game. 

This game is one i do not recommend you play. Maybe watch somebody do a lets play of it honestly. Sad to say as i've always had this fascination with this game since i was a child due to me not owning it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035690492', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1577393037}
review:
This is a very good example of a game that did not age well at all. Icons on maps during missions are close to non-existent, sometimes you gotta guess, theres no way to tell if you are "too close" to get spotted or not ( well you will find out by failing the mission sort of ).

Getting 4 or more cop stars is basically a death sentence. All the places feel boring, same and bland. 

If you are looking for a GTA game to play, pick San Andreas. 

If you beat San Andreas and you want to check out this game, well expect it to be much, much harder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025869791', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1577248823}
review:
I can see the appeal of this game in 2001, but whichever way you look at it the story is plain and BORING. "Go fetch me this, go get that, go kill this guy, go smash this **** up." Rinse and repeat across 5 flavors of gangs with no real character, direction or purpose until the very last mission. If you want to play this for the story then you have nothing to do here. It is nothing like GTA San Andreas or newer GTA games. Just read the opening and closing sequence on a wiki and walk away.

===[ Graphics: ]=== 
☐ Potato

author: {'steamid': '76561198099248926', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1575754557}
review: I played this game when it first launched in 2001. You will never be able to understand how revolutionary this game was when it first came out. Gta, gta london 1969, gta 2 were all just fun games with the birds eye view only. When this came out, it was a whole different take on 3rd person. Now as a teen back then I beat it with cheats, was a challenge. Now all these years later, I will say it will give you a run for your patience without cheats. Its very challenging. But challenge is good. It comes from a time where you health doesnt regenerate, and no autosaves. So playing this for a couple hours you get back into the older graphics. I reccomend it, im 20 hours in and 70% done with the game. Wasn't too bad until about 70% complete. But its still fun. The storyline is weak but thats the way it was. I have been and always will be a gta fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004320646', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1575320738}
review:
This is a true classic but it really shows its age. Compared to other GTA game they're not only better than GTA3, they're MILES better. 

The combat is god awful, the mission design is is boring and sometimes questionable as very odd things can get you wasted (fail the mission), you can't swim (!?), no map other than the HUD. The protagonist himself, Claude, is just useless. I don't like silent protagonists in general, they just seem like an excuse to move the plot along comfortably. What's worse is the almost all other characters are very uninteresting. The only one remotely interesting is Catalina and that's because of San Andreas, not 3 itself. But GTA3 is undeniably charming. It has that uniqe GTA feel to it, you know? When you're driving around, blasting good music on the radio, causing havoc, that is fun. But the overwhelming feeling I had during gameplay was just I wanted to finish it. Not a good sign. But it's an interesting time piece, a blueprint for what came from its legacy.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044133461', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1368, 'last_played': 1636742485}
review:
==========================================================================
                                                I N T R O 
==========================================================================

Backdoor of a bank. Bank alarm is ringing. 

Catalina: Sorry babe. I'm an ambitious girl. And you (gun shot), you're just  small time.

Police convoy crossing the city and heading to the Callahan Bridge. 

News: Liberty city is in shock today, as the police and emergency services deal with the aftermath, of a devastating attack on a police convoy this morning. As yet, no details have been released about the prisoners being transferred in the convoy, and no proof has claimed responsibility. A convoy left police headquarters early this morning, for a routine transfer of felons, to the Liberty City penitentiary. The attack took place on the Callahan Bridge, leaving few witnesses, and the bridge itself, severely damaged. Some of the convicts are thought to have perished, in the explosion that followed the initial attack. Revelations as to the professionalism of the attack, struck police hours afterward, when identification of the missing felons were further hampered by an attack, by computer hackers on police headquarter databases. With the Porter tunnel-project falling behind schedule, this disaster leaves Portland isolated from the rest of the city.

Colombian cartel cars stop the convoy and retrieve a prisoner by threatening police. 

Colombian Cartel: Come on! Senior dickhead! It's no problem to kill you. You gonna be sorry. A'right, a'right. Get lost.

8-ball knocks out a cop. A bomb dropped off on the bridge explodes. 

8-ball: I know a place on the edge of the Red Light District where we can lay  low, but my hands are all messed up so you better drive, brother.

Extra:

Addictive, fun, GTA 3 is a great old classic game. The radio stations make every car ride a joy (and if you don’t like the game’s radios you can add your own music library), the story is well written and the open map offers great opportunities for high speed car chases or AK47 rampages. Despite being nearly 20 years old, this game still has it. Only downside is the single player only gameplay. Mafiosi, yakuza, drug dealers and prostitutes: they are going to be your new found friends...and possibly your future enemies. Get ready to get backstabbed and set off a lot of explosions. Liberty City is waiting for you!

review: Grand Theft Auto III is another pivotal open world game that set many standards for the generation to come. While the visuals and sound haven't aged the best, the gameplay is wacky enough to keep you playing for quite some time. I highly recommend giving it a try, even if it feels very quaint compared to larger games that evolved in the years since this game's release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352842212', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1566073023}
review:
The classic game that started the gta formula as we know it today. There were other games in the series, but they very diffrent. They were in 2D, had a diffrent structure and played diffrently than the 3D games.

GTA III is a good game on it's own, but compared to its successors, it has some flaws.
The most important one is that the game has no full in-game map, only a minimap. Back in the day, the map came with the box, but if you buy it digitally, you don't get the map. This is a minor problem because one, you can look up a map on the internet and two, if you play all the missions you will eventually memorize the layout of the city . But it is a real pain in the *** for some missions where you have to go to a diffrent island and you don't know where you have to go to because you cannot look up your destination on a map.

Also a problem are the controls. Claude, the main character, cannot swim, nor can he duck or automatically aim. There is no cover system in this game unlike later GTA's so you will get hit whenever you see enemies, so kill them as quickly as possible. 
The music, although still good, is also not as good as other games in the series. There is much less music, and the music that is there is less good in my opion than that in other games. The talkshow was IMO the best radiostation of the game. 

There isn't really a big story compared to the other games in the series, and most of the cutscenes are someone telling Claude what to do and Claude nodding becuse he's a mute. Despite that, the missions are still worth playing because the game has some cool side characters and villains that will return later in the game, and most of the missions are really fun to play. They might be a bit challenging sometimes, but nothing to worry about since I've completed them and I'm generally terrible at games.

Overall, you might think I hate this game, but I don't. I really like this game despite all of its flaws and consider it a must buy for big GTA fans and fans of old classic games in general, not only to see where GTA became a cultural phenomenon, but also because it still a really good and fun game.

Also check out colour shed productions review of the game. It is really informative and tells you all you nedd to know of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034249692', 'num_games_owned': 2520, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3286, 'last_played': 1573486451}
review: I played this game way too late, now that it's already quite forgotten and people play GTA V instead (and even that has been out for a pretty long time now). How does it feel trying it for the first time after all these years? The first impressions weren't great. Everything felt dated, the initial animation seemed strangely blurry, the menus working badly until after starting the game, the graphics pretty old and the cars pretty awkward to control (and often rolling over) in comparison to what I'm used to. But I thought I should give it a chance and if I didn't like it, I'd just move on. After playing for a while and getting the hang of controlling it, it really grew on me. Discovering what the city had to offer and doing some first missions hooked me enough to stay. And then as I progressed, the missions got more interesting and I got access to better weaponry, I started having waaaaay too much fun with all the crazy random action going on and the intense, funny situations I was getting into. It's a bit difficult to pinpoint what exactly makes it so fun, but it feels like after every game session you get stories to talk about with your friends. This game really made me want to keep playing just because I was having too much fun. Did I care much for the missions? Well, they were decent and interesting to do, sure. Just to give you some goals. But it's not the game's strongest side, especially that Mafia came out around the same time and showed how storytelling in games should really be done. In GTA III, the story feels more like an addition than something you're deeply immersed in. But I am impressed how much detail was put in the design of the game's world for a game this old. And the radio stations were lots of fun to listen to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960905909', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1573135076}
review:
The game that kicked off the global phenomenon that is GTA, GTA 3 does lack a few quality of life features (mainly the big map in the pause menu, and the pay and spray + ammunation icons on the mini map itself) and features some of the hardest missions in the GTA series (and in my opinion, is the hardest GTA out of all the 3D games).

It is however a very enjoyable classic, and you will never be short on cash and will be able to cause all sorts of destruction as you want and the missions may be challenging, but completing them is sure a fun time (except those guys on SPANK, they give me nightmares).

author: {'steamid': '76561198095177706', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2512, 'last_played': 1648743130}
review: Hey, really hope this review is helpful but will mostly just be me bragging about how good this game is. Anyways, first things first, this came out in 2001, and that in and of itself deserves an applaud, (given the incredible graphics for the time, and still sharp visual effects and art direction) but literally revolutionised open world games. Almost 100% of the open world games you play today will have been influenced somehow by Grand Theft Auto III. It has loads to do, and a decent challenge level. This is my favourite Grand Theft Auto game, if not one of my favourite games of all time, (sure, part of that is nostalgia of Christmas, 2001). It has a great story of revenge, and manages to capture what rising up the ranks really feels like, great humour and voice acting, great writing, and not to mention they pulled this all off with i silent protagonist! driving feels great, and so does playing it. Highly Recommended!

review:
I recall playing this with my cousin back in the 2000's. I punched a granny and she shot me with a rocket launcher. Good times.

On a serious note though... I spent my latter childhood on GTA: Vice City and while this game certainly feels inferior to it (this was the first 3D GTA game after all) you can still have fun doing pretty much anything you want. Plus with 10€ per game (less in bundles/sale) you can't really complain about the quantity of playtime you're getting.

So yeah... go grab yourself a car and listen to Triads yell death threats at you. It's well worth it.

review: Grand Theft Auto III is just kind of meh. The driving isn't very good, the story is all over the place, and some of the missions are an absolute pain. The game is also quite short (Only about 5-6 hours). Overall, GTA III is worth a purchase if you want to see how far Rockstar has came in 18+ years. Besides that, I don't really see a reason in buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400978118', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1570455226}
review:
For regulars (6/10), for gaming veterans (8/10)
Honestly graphics are obviously ancient yet it doesn't look that bad considering how basic it is for present standarts. Enviroment is still great ...well except trees which look realy terrible and block vision and cops acting pretty much random. I mean sometimes you can ram patrol car or roll over someone who jumped in a way without response while sometimes they ram into you and go crazy. 
 And just like every GTA it has some missions you will simply hate but many things are still blast like (Yakuza) Stinger, Uzi or M16 or some dialogs (mission, radios) ...unless you heard them few dozen times.

review: Its a very good game. I dont really care about 100% completion so i use cheats like "gunsgunsguns" the guns in this game are minimal, but great. They all serve different purposes (except maybe the pistol) The m16 is for shredding, the Ak is for saving ammo. Ive played 4,5, and SA and this felt different from San Andreas. Its a really good starting place for a great franchise. Of course we are used to flying bikes and space cannons, but this is a nice place to relax and play the story.

review:
This was the reason i had to buy a PS2 back in the days, its was a big deal.
So many years later i replay it on computer. I have to say that there is lots of bugs still, i would have thought a game this big over so many years would have fixed most of it. I mean the aim/shooting is waay off target lol, and many missions are impossible now i dont know what they have done with the NPC damage, but its like half a sec and your shield and health is gone. Police and gangs around blow up your car in less then a second in some missions, it's terrible. (trying to play through the game without cheats is almost impossible now due to the perfect aim NPC's have and the damage they do, super fast spraying.. while aiming is terrible and its not even 100% on target so your bullets dont match the crosshair's...

author: {'steamid': '76561198055635659', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1590121522}
review:
If you really wanna understand just how far ahead of the rest GTA III was when it came out, consider this. Before this game came out, it was VERY rare for any game to have both driving and walking on foot in it. The only other previous example that comes to mind is Driver 2 on the Playstation 1.... and the on foot controls in that game were trash.

Every little thing you can do in this game was something you would previously have to buy a separate game to do. Want to play taxi missions on a home console? You're gonna need a Dreamcast for that. For third person shooters we have a few options on the PS1, like Syphon Filter. Open world driving game? That's what Driver is for. And open world racing? Rockstar just started putting those on console with Smuggler's Run and Midnight Club. How about a game where you can drive a cop car and ram into people? Need for Speed III, also a PS1 game.

There were also some other options if you had a decent enough PC at the time, but it was limited. Point being, when GTA III came out and put ALL of that into one game, and you could get it on a home console, it's understandable why people would lose their minds over it. It opened people's eyes further on the kinds of things that were possible to put into a video game.

But now it's 2019, and it hasn't aged that badly at all. You play a game like Driver, which came 2 years before it, and it's like night and day. Sure, being the PC version, there's a few hiccups you have to get around (the thumbsticks on my controller don't work properly with this game's settings), but if you can make it work, it's worth it. Even today, there's few other games that play like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138786964', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 4345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1499, 'last_played': 1585481021}
review:
Until a while ago, I thought I knew the GTA games like I knew the back of my hand. Turned out I thought wrong. I was finally getting a proper gaming computer where I can play all the latest games no problem, and GTA V was one of them. You can say that it's already a pretty old game for 2019 but it wouldn't hurt to be updated with all major AAA games would it. As long as it's not an EA title, it's going to be alright. Because you know the same way I do, EA bad, hail Geraldo, upvotes to the left.

It would have been way too appropriate to start the binge-play from the very first release, GTA I and then GTA II, but Steam doesn't allow for buy those two games nowadays for some reason, I know, a shame. So the safest start was GTA III, probably the most underplayed game from my part in the franchise.

I remember the first time when I got to play this revolutionary game on a cybercafe way back in the day when I could only count in the three digits and be proud of it. Way too young to play a game that matures, but people from my generation all grew up the same.

Playing a game from the early '20s in 2019 seems a bit of a downgrade, talking graphically, vocally, functionally, but not gameplay-wise surprisingly, but there was still a lot to be picky about. I played the steam version lately, the same version that had some weird patch that broke some stuff off which was really annoying, I was okay with it, I didn't really notice anything at first until I started to watch a few gameplays of the game on Youtube and noticed how different everything was, talking about the color palette.
The game was extremely dark, and I thought GTA IV was a dark (atmospherically) game. Not every vehicle had their proper colors in display, everything was in a darkened shade of itself making it hard to see anything without having to raise the brightness a few levels or maybe to the max. And don't even get me started on the broken vehicle handling where as soon as you trying to drive backward, the vehicle down speeds a sick turtle as if it was pulling mountains worth of mass slowing you down and making it almost impossible to drive back without losing your nerves.
But the biggest annoyance or I was the inappropriate UI scaling, the aspect ratio looked like having a stroke, and the map's marker is so tiny that a needle couldn't possibly poke them.
Luckily, there was a community patch I installed which fixes all of these annoyances and made it a far greater experience to have, the UI scaled properly, the vehicles and the overall atmosphere got back their nature vibrant colors, and the vehicle handling got a lot better. But the problem lies in the fact that you have to look for problems and solve something that the game should have had solved from the get-go, given the fact that it's a paid game and from a pretty big-name game developer. Rockstar, please fix.

I did not want to alter the game too much or else I would miss on playing the vanilla game, but oh boy was the absence of a grand scale map annoying. Sadly enough, yes, there was no way to see the game's map, at least, not one that I know of.

Given the nit-picking, GTA III is a solid open-world that gives you all the opportunities a maniac would want to break havoc and start an all-out war with the state's authorities. It's always fun to blow up speeding FBI cars while driving an obese world war 1 looking tank, all guns maxed out and a sheet of cheats by your side. Rival gangs would always initiate the shooting, which is fun and challenging, almost daring you to step into their territories. But what is there to be scared of? Claude is a badass silent character, and weirdly enough, he takes part in a Scarface-Esque storyline with a lot of openly-talked characters, he never has to say anything, maybe he has already seen everything.
The storyline isn't anything overly complicated of thoughts provoking, but it doesn't make it any less bombastic, most of the missions involve driving all sorts of vehicles the most with some aspect of shooting, the latter is a bit stiff, coming from the modern take of shooters, it does feel out of place, we're talking about a game that has no cover system, no button that enables crouching and no level grinding weapon system that advances the more you play. There is a relatively small collection of weapons in the game, not a lot of praise here, however, the gore is not trying to be any less subtle, I don't see this in modern games, but the sight of shooting people in precise body joins can sever their limbs, heads or blow them up altogether, crazy how the technology was all there from way back.

I appreciate the spacious game map, it spans two major cities with a respectable size, and two small/medium islands in the sides, all being opened to you to visit as you progress through the game's mission. I like how the map has a very low learning curve to memorize, very easy to navigate and just after a few hours of playing.

I feel like reviewing any of the GTA games, it's always worth having a separate paragraph to talking about the phenomenal hilarious radio stations that come with the games, some times, I would just launch the game, enter a car and scroll through the collection of radio stations and just listen to them at my leisure time, and to be honest, the radio stations alone deserve the full price of the game. A lot of land-marking songs from the '80s, hilarious radio show talks that never get old, it's all a good time.

For what was a game I just had to grind through to fill the hungry completionist nature that would agonize me if I hadn't gone through the first games before advancing to the more modern ones, I had a blast playing this classic. It's always nice to visit the older generation of games, after all, old doesn't mean bad, there are older games that hold more value than a game that will be released in 20 years from now could ever have. Between the driving, the story, the police chases and of course, the cheat codes, GTA III holds decently even nowadays.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983716309', 'num_games_owned': 2225, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3411, 'last_played': 1566040484}
review:
It's buggy (you need to run it in Windows compatibility mode and even once you manage to get in game it's a real effort to be able to even see the menus. You need to play around with them and alt tab or move mouse around a lot just to get them to show) it's outdated and clunky (game runs at 30fps and if you try and get more than that then serious game breaking bugs occur) but it's still a lot of fun. The missions for me feel very easy and boring, there's no real linear story to it. Just simple 2-3 minute missions consisting of go whack this guy or jack that car but to be fair to the game, in 2001 this was revolutionary and for that reason alone this game must and should be considered one of the all time greats in the Open World category. 

In my opinion, it's a game that should only be played if you have either completed or none of the later open world games available interest you. Don't purchase this game with the mindset of something like: I wonder what I have missed or what this game has that later titles don't, because there really isn't anything. However, if you love GTA and like me you like to start at the very beginning of something before moving on to the newer titles (I consider 3d to be the very beginning because I just can't play 2d games, they don't interest me) then this game is a must purchase, because like I stated, this was the beginning of GTA in the 3d world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062254246', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1564870247}
review:
One of the most iconic GTA games ever made. It´s 2019 and the game is still really good even compared to games nowaday.
Ofcourse graphics are not great anymore and game has it´s flaws but overall I recommend to play it through atleast once.
Story is great once you get on it and there is really lots of things to do as always in GTA.
It took me around 30hours to get 100% completion and game is around 5-10euros so i call it worth to buy.

Pros:
+Story is good
+Interesting characters
+Lots of different vehicles and even dodo:D
+Many side things to do along with main story

Cons:
-Some parts of game feel little rushed, since some things were removed just before launch
-Game can be really annoying sometimes, and some missions are really hard to complete 
-There is no map so if you are new player, it will take time to know the city
-Few bugs in steam version of game (menus disappear and stuff)

In nutshell: GTA 3 is first 3D game in the series so it has it flaws and not that much content as later ones, but it is still a masterpiece and back in the days one of the best games made. Definetely recommend buying it and giving it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007786864', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 4230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4230, 'last_played': 1563939747}
review:
While not the first introduction, this installment in the [b]Grand Theft Auto[/b] franchise continues the crime infested storytelling following the mysteriously silent protagonist, namely Claude Speed, from its predecessor. In this sequel, Claude is violently betrayed by his longtime partner Catalina and seeks revenge after being left to die. He now enters the depths of Liberty City to not only reclaim his revenge but status as a cold-blooded criminal rising to mob fame through favors from syndicates and other scum infesting the community.

Unlike its previous notable overhead perspective experience, this installment features vast improvements giving newcomers and previous fans more freedom and extensive exploration. While maintaining its previous arcade style, it still challenges players to navigate stages and missions with every resource at their disposal while using a mini navigator hinting their objectives and other potential interests. The entire landscape of Liberty City is divided into different areas but never feels entirely disconnected even when certain parts are temporarily blocked from exploration.

Players could experience the main story with additional quests to unlock perks to help them thrive and become wealthier. But regardless how much money they earn they're only limited to weapons and immediately loses flair once they've completed enough missions. Also some missions may feel repetitive, as failure is quite constant, and are only available under certain conditions until completion. If players are capable to finish the game without cheating, there's unfortunately not enough extra content that would otherwise initiate instant replay.

Despite these flaws, including having hilariously wonky physics, this installment proved itself to be worth playing for its adventurous storytelling and becoming one of the most entertaining games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030193228', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1674553439}
review:
Sotry - 2/5
Characters - 2/5
World - 3/5
Gameplay - 3/5
Atmosphere - 3/5

If you played later GTAs and you want to complete the trilogy: buy! If not: pass!

- Looking back at this game it sure brings memories... and nerves. It is a revolutionary game, yet when compared to other great games of that time period (e.g. Mafia a year later) this one is bad. Gameplay is too much arcade. Cars will spin and jump in the air every time you hit something even ever so slightly, aiming is terrible and you loose lives too fast. Alright, so it is a fast paced game but it is also equaly as maddening. Many missions are made frustrating just because of these things and the stupid AI. The police will try to ram you as if you were playing a demilition derby. Directions are bad and although there is a minimap, there is no big map that should be viewable in the menu so navigating betweet the islands is sometimes impossible and really annoying. What's more some missions are very poorly explained and it isn's clear what you should do until you mess up. 

- There isn's much of a story as the main guy is mute and does not ever disagree with what he is told to do. He will work for mafia, yakuza and crooked polititians. The whole story is just about how bunch of gangs tossed around this poor mute sociopath to settle their accounts with each other. BUT if you would like to see how some of the characters from San Andreas and Vice City ended up, it's there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101658065', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 3517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1563562868}
review:
Pros
- It's GTA.
- Enjoyable story, mission, and side mission.
- HD texture mods are available to use, and its doing a very good job upgrading the old graphic texture.
- Has more content than what i expected.
- Nostalgia.
- One of the game that changed open-world genre.

Cons
- You probably need a fan made patch to even play this game on modern hardware.
- Does not age well, lots of glitch in Steam version. Patchable.
- Broken Aspect ratio when using modern monitor, need a patch to play it in Full HD.
- No built in controller support.
- Wongky physics.
- Extreme glitching when playing the game with more than 85+ fps.

Gameplay : 9/10
Story         : 7.5/10 
Graphics    : 7/10 (Vanilla)
Sound        : 8.5/10
Content      : 8.5/10

review: This game is a classic. One of my first memories of enjoying video games was starting out playing this game on the PS2, the first day my brother and I got that console. It was my first time experiencing an open-world game of this sort and I thought it was brilliant. Reliving that experience in the familiar setting that I know all too well has been enjoyable.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198319144476', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1888, 'last_played': 1544454764}
review: I'm giving it a recommendation because it was probably good for its time, but I was pretty underwhelmed after playing it for the first time in 2019. I was hoping for a similar experience as Vice City (also recently played first time), but I did not feel the same vibe. Unlike GTA4, it did not feel like NYC at all, and since there is no large map, I never really knew where I was. Many of the vehicles are also featured in Vice City and there are no aerial vehicles, so I do not feel it contributed significantly to my GTA experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989290281', 'num_games_owned': 1554, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1564388308}
review:
https://youtu.be/bKrVmPeCzvg

Okay, so the graphics and animations are a rough by today's standards, and the controls can be a little twitchy. There are also some bugs and glitches that were never patched - so basically your typical rockstar PC port. 

However the game itself remains fun at heart. Lots of action, plenty of whacky characters and a decent story. And then you have the side missions and collectables to find. For the money you are getting a lot of game that helped shape the modern open world game of today.

Still a classic and well worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020553677', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1562011779}
review:
Played through to completion from disk (barring that last hidden package!)
Repurchased on Steam to keep all my games in one play

Whatever you're looking for this game has it all - from racing to action, from dialogue to stories, from puzzles to completing sets - there's something here for everyone without the later instalments' requirements for you to have decent driving skills

Difficulty isn't too high, eventually money becomes ubiquitous and you're free to do more or less whatever you like after the first hour or so's work

Loved the nightlife and the graphics take me back memories from Y2K, on par with Far Cry 1-2

7/10 - Because it's good, but Vice City is prettier

review: An interesting trip down memory lane. We see the skeleton of future grand theft auto titles established here. Noticing how the story and game mechanics have changed from this game gives us an interesting look into the minds of the people at Rockstar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040735667', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1495303765}
review: After reviews massacred GTA2 for being a Hotline Miami clone, Rockstar understandably moved to 3D, deciding to focus on the past of the second game's protagonist, Claude. You play the part of idiot for hire, avoiding death from all sides from the same gangs you execute missions for. The story's pretty straightforward too, with Claude karmically killing the same people that betrayed him. It's pretty old, but games like this one defined the open-world crime sandbox genre, and the fun is basically guaranteed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196816453', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1643433142}
review: From the beginning up until like three quarters of the progress in Staunton Island, the game decently enjoyable. The cracks begin to form soon afterwards, the game is painful. From clunky controls to unfair missions, you begin to feel frustrated. Grand Theft Auto III has no checkpoints or replay functions whatsoever – this means that when you fail a mission, most likely from dying, you respawn at the hospital, have to buy back every single gun you had, drive back to the mission marker and finally start from rock bottom. This isn't fun, especially when you failed the same mission over and over again – trust me it will happen to you, unless you are some sort of being transcending the human limit, or a speedrunner!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000208827', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4141, 'last_played': 1673727656}
review:
Still the best GTA out there.
The graphics are somehow better than in VC and SA. The missions are significantly less scripted than in 4 and 5.
The driving is good: the camera keeps up with the car on turns, so you do not need to constantly move the camera with your mouse while driving (like in 4 and 5).
The game is arcade enough, without too much realism, so it is fun to play. (For instance, you can just pick up a "star" to shake off the police without a need to hide from them for 5 minutes like in GTA5.)
The city is not that big like in other games of the series, which is a good thing: almost every place has some meaning in the game, e.g. has a mission in it or has a hidden secret.

review:

-------------------------------------
The game hasn't aged well in some places, but it's still a good game overall. The storytelling is a bit weak, characters are introduced that completely disappear after a few missions, the physics feel a bit off by today's standards, the minimap isn't all that helpful, and there are some missions that will make you wonder if the game was even playtested before release. Also, playing at higher framerates than 30 tend to break the physics. However, most of this is excusable due to the time the game was made. It was their first GTA in 3D, they were still figuring things out. The game is best played with mods that bring some quality of life changes to the game, such as a full map view. The game is still worth revisting today as a look back to how the open world genre of today got its start, but maybe not for 10 dollars. If you really want to buy GTA III, wait for a sale. If you just want a GTA game to play, and you can't run GTA IV or V, you'd probably be better off getting San Andreas, downgrading it, and installing mods to apply some bug patches not present in the Steam release. From what I've heard, there's also apparently a full conversion of GTA III to San Andreas as well, so if you can find it you could play GTA III with the more polished engine and features of San Andreas. The authentic experience is still a piece of gaming history. Without GTA III, the landscape of games, especially open world games, it would not look the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109076814', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1647650376}
review:
I'm seeing a pattern here. Fantastic games in the GTA Series getting negative reviews because they flat out don't work as they should.

GTA III is a legendary game but this Steam version is extremely broken. Menus go invisible, cars don't go into reverse, and the game crashes at the drop of a feather. Do yourself a favor and buy an old PS2 or PS3 and get the game on there. Heck, even the iOS version is far more functional than this.

EDIT: A few months later, I went back because I felt like revisiting. You are going to need the following mods in order to get this working: 

d3d8.dll from [url=https://github.com/crosire/d3d8to9/releases/tag/v1.7.0]here[/url]. 
Put the file in your GTA 3 directory, then turn on V-Sync for gta3.exe in your GPU control panel. Be sure to turn off VSYNC and Frame Limiter in the game's options. If you have a high refresh rate monitor, change your display's refresh rate 60 FPS.

SteamCarColourFix.asi from [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/uus9l55495zh89z/SteamCarColourFix.rar?dl=0]here[/url]. 
Put the file in your GTA 3 directory. Does not require an external asi loader. 

If you want controller support, use [url=https://www.gtagarage.com/mods/show.php?id=24272]this[/url]. Follow the instructions in the archive on how to install and configure.

FINAL SCORE GAME: 8/10
FINAL SCORE PC PORT: 1/10
IN A NUTSHELL: Yet another one of Rockstar's great games abandoned and left behind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049460405', 'num_games_owned': 1619, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1560449428}
review:
Одна из самых душных игр, которую мне довелось пройти. Сломанная к хуям стрельба (особенно из М16, валящая как обезьяна под спидами, которая и занималась физикой оружия в этой игре), машины уходящие в неуправляемый занос от малейшего дуновения ветра, бетонные кустики об которые ранее упомянутые драндулеты делают кульбит и взрываются не давая выйти (покинуть машину в движении нельзя, остаётся только смотреть как горящий кусок говна совершает свой последний пируэт и попутно рвать волосы на голове), угловатые леджи при спринте с коих ГГ делает непреднамеренный квантовый прыжок прямиком в смерть (проблема исключительно нефиксированного фреймрейта, но в 15 фпс я играть отказываюсь), охуительные миссии в духе "снеси 9 лотков с кофе, но где - мы тебе не скажем, они раскиданы по всей доступной карте, дерзай" или "продержись на 6 звёздах 3 минуты". Вишенкой на торте из кала, как это бывает, является последняя миссия, где отобрав всё оружие, игра бросает против тебя позолоченную орду колумбийцев и босса-вертолёта (сбрасывающего бомбы тебе на голову, разумеется), который ещё долгие месяцы будет сниться мне в кошмарах. Кстати, сюжета тут нет от слова совсем. Есть кое-как связанные между собой задания, где Клода посылают сделать штуку X без какого-либо понимания нахуй герой должен этим заниматься, в чём конечная цель и что он по этому поводу думает. Немой протагонист - это наихудшее решение для криминальной драмы, где нарратив непременно повязан вокруг характера и амбиций главного героя, которых у Клода просто нет.  

В целом, по ходу игры у меня сложилось стойкое ощущение, что игру банально не успели доделать. Она по всем параметрам уступает Вайс Сити и, в отличие от него же, абсолютно не проходит проверку временем. Ностальгические очки и отговорки про технологический прорыв в жанре не канают. Трёшке нечего предложить игроку кроме местами зубодробительной сложности, достигнутой самым идиотским способом, а именно - ебучим рандомом и мясом. 

P.S. Дробовик попаданием в упор сносит машину одним выстрелом мгновенно и без горения, что ставит крест на попытке спокойно проехать по району с мафией, где проходят и выполняются сюжетные миссии. Попадание полностью зависит от удачи: спавн хуесоса с дробовиком может случиться в метре от того, где проезжает игрок. Если это не ёмко говорит о глубине проработки геймдизайна, то я не знаю что. Надеюсь того, кто сознательно оставил эту потрясающую деталь в игре отправили на принудительную лоботомию.

P.P.S. В ИГРЕ НЕТ ПОЛНОЦЕННОЙ КАРТЫ! ПОЧЕМУ?! Вайс Сити вышла всего на год позже. Я не верю, что это была настолько революционная идея даже для 2001 года.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115847063', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1560750982}
review:
GTA 3 was one of the most groundbreaking games of its time. It doesn't quite hold up as well today as Vice City and San Andreas but there is still a lot of fun to be had 

Pros:
Fun open world
Some great missions
Lots of collectables
Fun Wanted system


Cons:
Dull story 
Horrible camera
Some bugs and glitches
A few awful missions

Overall if you see this game on sale you should give it a try. It's definitely the worst of the 3D GTA games but without this groundbreaking game they wouldn't exist

author: {'steamid': '76561198800209514', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2050, 'last_played': 1616325152}
review:
GTA III is a real classic, even though it's the least technologically advanced part of the series (counting the 3D games of course). The atmosphere is great and still there, the gameplay is (aaalmost) pure fun, and Rockstar's humor is all over the place. Liberty City is definitely an interesting place to visit and explore. I also quite dig all the radiostations, with MSX FM being one of my favourites in all the series. If you've never played it before, like the retro 3D graphics and games that shouldn't be taken too seriously: well, you might be in for a treat!

8,5-9/10 for me. Definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995899563', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2251, 'last_played': 1600443975}
review:
[h1]Shotgun beats car, tank beats shotgun, baseball bat beats tank[/h1]

[b]Grand Theft Auto 3[/b], for PC

Rating: [b]8.2/10[/b]; Great

Highly recommended for fans of GTA, though if you have not played any similar games you may want to play a later game instead of this one.


Grand Theft Auto 3 is a third person shooting and driving game which pretty much created the genre of “GTA clone”.  The story is not bad, though it is nothing amazing.  What is amazing is the ambiance and world building that make the game world seem like a real city with real people.  Everything from the way random pedestrians and drivers act and speak to the in game radio stations, signs and places to visit.  It is fairly common to see random npc behaviour cause vehicle accidents or crimes which can result in emergency vehicles being summoned.

The basic gameplay has you go around on foot with some simple running and jumping, and the ability to melee, shoot and get in and out of vehicles.  The console version features an annoying control scheme where the character must first turn in the direction you want him to move, rather than sidestepping or backpedalling.  Most guns also use an auto target lock system instead of allowing free aim.  The PC version allows you to use the console movement and shooting control scheme, or one more typical of a shooter (which has no auto targeting).  The shooting is poor though because only the sniper rifle and RPG allow precise single shots.  For all other guns, you must hold down the shoot button and fire the gun as fast as possible because of the time delay between the normal stance and shooting stance before a shot is fired.  This delay has a pretty good chance of getting you killed if you try and pick your shots or conserve ammo.

Where the game shines is with the driving.  With multiple camera views to choose from, solid controls and different performance for different vehicles, the sheer act of driving around the city is tons of fun just by itself; regardless of whether or not you obey traffic laws.  On top of this, you get high speed chases, vehicle combat, racing, jumps and other cool things to do with your vehicles.  The open world nature also makes each play session and repeated mission attempts different, because traffic and pedestrians are random.  Most missions allow you to bring whatever vehicle you want, or to switch to new vehicles you find, which can have tactical implication for the mission.

However despite how great the core gameplay is, there are a number of minor issues that bring the game down.  The most annoying part of the game is how rival gangs become hostile and their randomly and infinitely respawning members on the street shoot at you the instant they see you, regardless of what you are doing or driving.  They must have magic or something.  This is not a huge deal by itself, but when they have shotguns you will be faced with many sudden and random deaths.  You see, for some reason shotguns are comparable to other guns when damaging people, but they can VERY quickly destroy vehicles.  It is more like a mini RPG launcher.  I find it hard to believe that this made it past quality control as something that is acceptable and fun for a game.  

There are several other poor design decisions that make the game less fun.  The lack of a map in the pause menu makes it very obnoxious to get around.  Even when I was near the end of the game and I knew my way around fairly well, sometimes I still had to drive around for a couple minutes to figure out where exactly I was and wanted to go.  It was especially annoying to have a timed objective and be unable to check a bigger map to see where it was.  Also extremely annoying was the lack of map icons for ammunition, pay n spray and other useful things (unless going there was needed for a mission).  This made it harder than necessary to do routine things (like get more ammo) and is made even worse by the fact that the map icons exist in the game, but are just not used.

Despite its flaws, this is an amazing game which is well worth every hour played, even if those hours are spent just running or driving around rather than doing any structured activities.


Pro [list]
[*]Fairly good story and dialogue
[*]Very immersive world with npc dialogue, activity, behaviour etc.  Plenty of interesting things to observe simply by standing around and watching the world
[*]Option to use WSAD style movement (where left and right strafe, and back backpedals), or console GTA style movement (where you first turn in the direction you want to go)
[*]Good driving, with solid controls, variable performance for each vehicle and surface
[*]Vehicles display damage, and based on where the damage occurred
[*]Game does not end
[*]Large variety of things to do besides story missions
[*]Decent enemy AI, especially when they are driving
[/list]
Con [list]
[*]Jumping over things (like walls) is harder than it should be
[*]Cannot change weapons while game is paused (it often takes too long to select the weapon you want), which is made worse by…
[*]Inability to run with most weapons, and only the weakest allow running
[*]No reloading until the current clip is empty
[*]Bad shooting (except sniper rifle and rpg), where there is such a delay between pressing the shoot button and the guy shooting that you have to hold down the button and fire full auto all the time (or semi auto as fast as possible for guns which are not full auto)
[*]No ability to melee with guns (especially noticeable when random pedestrians start punching you during a rocket launcher rampage)
[*]Grenades/molotovs cannot be aimed and are thus very difficult to throw.  Also very high chance of hurting yourself
[*]Hostile gang members that infinitely respawn and shoot at you regardless of what you are doing.  The ones with shotguns are extremely overpowered and WAY too easily destroy vehicles
[*]Some activities (mainly paramedic) end if you get out of the vehicle.  I did accidentally press “f” to exit the vehicle on paramedic level 11
[*]Many missions and activities have unforgiving time limits.  While I like the pressure to drive both fast and safely, some of the time limits are way too short
[*]One mission about following a trail of porn magazines which has such a bad time limit that I finished it with 1 second remaining after 10+ attempts
[*]Collectables and minor missions do not show up on the map.  It is too hard to find them and keep track of what you have done
[*]No large map in game (which makes it obnoxiously difficult to find things and get around)
[*]Map icons are only occasionally present during some missions.  Things like the safe house, pay n spray, ammo store, hospitals, police stations etc should always show on the map
[*]Mini map automatically changes zoom based on how fast you are going.  Given the lack of main map, I would want max zoomed out all the time
[*]Third island is poorly designed.  Why is there no shortcut leading from the airport area to the safe house area?
[*]Can’t swim (you drown instead)
[*]Can only save at safe houses
[*]People cannot take damage while inside a car (no shooting people through windows)
[*]Money is not used for much, and you can use other means to get armor and weapons.  Money is more like a score
[*]Police attention is extremely unrealistic.  Things like speeding, driving on the wrong side or sidewalk, ignoring stop signs and traffic lights, accidents, and killing people with vehicles do not get attention (you have to kill a lot of people).  Killing someone with a gun, accident with police vehicle, assaulting police and stealing police vehicles only give minor attention.  These things should give more police attention to make the game more challenging and encourage legal driving for important missions.  Driving a tank should give automatic max police attention
[*]Cannot replay missions
[*]Escort mission where the ally driver got stuck in an alley and I had to kill him and try again
[/list]
